  4403                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4404                                  
  4405                                  ;	entry point to call utility functions in Bios_Code. At this time,
  4406                                  ;	  we aren't doing any A20 switching. During MSINIT time Bios_Code
  4407                                  ;	  will not yet be moved to its final resting place, so we know
  4408                                  ;	  it'll be low.
  4409                                  ;
  4410                                  ;	to use this function, do a "push cs" and load bp with the offset of
  4411                                  ;	  the function you want to call in Bios_Code. This routine will
  4412                                  ;	  push the address of a retf in Bios_Code onto the stack which
  4413                                  ;	  will get executed when the utility function finishes. It will
  4414                                  ;	  then transfer control to Bios_Code:bp using a couple of pushes
  4415                                  ;	  and a retf
  4416                                  
  4417                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4418                                  ;BC_RETF equ bc_retf - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  4419                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4420                                  BC_RETF equ bc_retf
  4421                                  
  4422                                  addr_of_bcretf:	;dw 0C8h		; dw bc_retf
  4423                                  					; 2C7h:0C8h = 70h:2638h
  4424 00001763 [C800]                  		dw BC_RETF
  4425                                  
  4426                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4427                                  
  4428                                  call_bios_code:	; proc far			
  4429 00001765 2EFF36[6317]            		push	word [cs:addr_of_bcretf] 
  4430                                  					; set up near return to far return
  4431 0000176A 2EFF36[E006]            		push	word [cs:cdev+2] ; push Bios_Code segment
  4432 0000176F 55                      		push	bp		; save offset of utility function
  4433 00001770 CB                      		retf			; far jump to (DOS)BIOS code
  4434                                  
  4435                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4436                                  
  4437 00001771 00                      flp_drvs	db 0			
  4438                                  
  4439                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4440                                  
  4441                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  4442                                  
  4443                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4444                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  4445                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4446                                  
  4447                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  4448                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  4449                                  		;=============================================================
  4450                                  		;
  4451                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  4452                                  		;
  4453                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4454                                  		;   ch = media byte
  4455                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  4456                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  4457                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  4458                                  
  4459                                  		; 07/04/2018
  4460                                  		;=============================================================
  4461                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  4462                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4463                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4464                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  4465                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  4466                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4467                                  		
  4468 00001772 FA                      		cli
  4469                                  
  4470                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4471                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4472                                  		;push	ax
  4473                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  4474                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4475                                  		;pop	ax
  4476                                  	
  4477                                  ; 02/10/2022
  4478                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4479                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4480                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4481                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4482                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4483                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4484                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  4485                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4486                                  
  4487                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4488                                  
  4489                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4490                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4491                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  4492                                  
  4493 00001773 2EA3[CE16]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4494 00001777 2E891E[CC16]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4495                                  
  4496                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4497                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4498                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4499                                  
  4500 0000177C 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4501 0000177D 07                      		pop	es
  4502 0000177E 51                      		push	cx
  4503 0000177F 57                      		push	di
  4504                                  
  4505                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4506                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4507                                  		; 24/12/2022
  4508                                  		; ds = cs
  4509 00001780 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  4510 00001782 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  4511                                  		; ds = 0
  4512                                  
  4513 00001784 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4514                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4515                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4516                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4517 00001786 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4518                                  next_int_:		
  4519 00001789 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4520 0000178A AC                      		lodsb		
  4521                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4522 0000178B 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4523 0000178C D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4524 0000178E D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4525 00001790 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4526 00001792 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4527                                  					; saving address in di
  4528 00001794 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  4529 00001795 AB                      		stosw
  4530 00001796 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  4531 00001797 AB                      		stosw			; save the vector
  4532 00001798 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4533 0000179A E2ED                    		loop	next_int_
  4534 0000179C 5F                      		pop	di
  4535 0000179D 59                      		pop	cx
  4536                                  
  4537                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4538                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4539                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4540                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4541                                  
  4542                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4543                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4544                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4545                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4546                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4547                                  
  4548                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4549 0000179E C7064C00[7407]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4550                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4551                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4552 000017A4 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4553                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4554 000017A8 C7065400[4808]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4555                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4556                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4557 000017AE 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4558                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4559 000017B2 C7066400[F907]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4560                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4561                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4562 000017B8 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4563                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4564                                  
  4565                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4566 000017BC 0E                      		push	cs
  4567 000017BD 1F                      		pop	ds
  4568                                  		
  4569 000017BE A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4570 000017C1 A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4571 000017C4 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4572 000017C7 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4573                                  					; ;
  4574 000017CA FB                      		sti
  4575 000017CB CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4576                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4577                                  
  4578                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4579                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4580                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4581                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4582                                  ;
  4583                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4584                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4585                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4586                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4587                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4588                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4589                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4590                                  
  4591                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4592                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4593                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4594                                  ;
  4595                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4596                                  ; to do anything special.
  4597                                  ;
  4598                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4599                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4600                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4601                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4602                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4603                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4604                                  
  4605                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4606 000017CD A801                    		test	al, 1
  4607                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4608 000017CF 752C                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4609                                  
  4610                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4611                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4612                                  ;
  4613                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4614                                  ;
  4615                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4616                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4617                                  
  4618 000017D1 50                      		push	ax
  4619 000017D2 53                      		push	bx
  4620 000017D3 51                      		push	cx
  4621 000017D4 52                      		push	dx
  4622 000017D5 57                      		push	di
  4623 000017D6 06                      		push	es
  4624 000017D7 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4625 000017D9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4626 000017DB CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4627                                  					; DL = drive number
  4628                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4629                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4630                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4631 000017DD 7204                    		jb	short _gdskp_error
  4632                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4633                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4634                                  		; ds = cs
  4635 000017DF 8816[7117]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4636                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4637 000017E3 07                      		pop	es
  4638 000017E4 5F                      		pop	di
  4639 000017E5 5A                      		pop	dx
  4640 000017E6 59                      		pop	cx
  4641 000017E7 5B                      		pop	bx
  4642 000017E8 58                      		pop	ax
  4643 000017E9 7212                    		jb	short normalfloppydrv
  4644                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4645                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4646                                  
  4647                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4648                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4649                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4650                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4651 000017EB A0[7117]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4652 000017EE 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  4653 000017F0 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4654                                  
  4655                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4656                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4657 000017F2 48                      		dec	ax
  4658 000017F3 EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4659                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4660                                  
  4661                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4662                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4663 000017F5 B80100                  		mov	ax, 1			
  4664 000017F8 A2[E116]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  4665                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4666                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4667                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4668 000017FB EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4669                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4670                                  
  4671                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4672 000017FD D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4673 000017FF D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4674                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  4675                                  		;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  4676                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4677 00001801 2403                    		and	al, 3
  4678 00001803 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  4679 00001805 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  4680                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  4681                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4682                                  		; ds = cs
  4683 00001806 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  4684                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this
  4685                                  notsingle:				
  4686 0000180A 40                      		inc	ax		; ax has number	of drives, 2-4
  4687                                  					; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  4688                                  					; booted off hard file
  4689 0000180B 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  4690                                  
  4691                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4692                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4693                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4694                                  BRKADR	 EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address
  4695                                  TIMADR	EQU	1CH * 4	; 70H, 1CH timer interrupt
  4696                                  DSKADR	EQU	1EH * 4	; address of ptr to disk parameters
  4697                                  SEC9	EQU	522h	; address of disk parameters
  4698                                  CHROUT	EQU	29h
  4699                                  LSTDRV	EQU     504h
  4700                                  
  4701                                  ; determine whether we booted from floppy or hard disk...
  4702                                  
  4703 0000180D F6C280                  		test	dl, 80h		; boot from floppy ?
  4704 00001810 7502                    		jnz	short gothrd	; no.
  4705 00001812 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; indicate boot	from drive a
  4706                                  gothrd:					
  4707 00001814 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx		; ax = 0-based drive we	booted from
  4708                                  					; bios_l, bios_h set.
  4709                                  					; cl = number of floppies including fake one
  4710                                  					; ch = media byte
  4711 00001816 FA                      		cli
  4712 00001817 8ED2                    		mov	ss, dx		; set stack segment and stack pointer
  4713 00001819 BC0007                  		mov	sp, 700h
  4714 0000181C FB                      		sti
  4715 0000181D 51                      		push	cx ; *		; save number of floppies and media byte
  4716 0000181E 88EC                    		mov	ah, ch		; FAT ID to AH
  4717 00001820 50                      		push	ax ; **		; save boot drive number and media byte
  4718                                  		
  4719                                  ; let model_byte, secondary_model_byte be set here!!!
  4720                                  
  4721 00001821 B4C0                    		mov	ah, 0C0h
  4722 00001823 CD15                    		int	15h		; SYSTEM - GET CONFIGURATION (XT after 1/10/86,AT mdl 3x9,CONV,XT286,PS)
  4723 00001825 7215                    		jb	short no_rom_system_conf ; just	use Model_Byte
  4724 00001827 80FC00                  		cmp	ah, 0
  4725 0000182A 7510                    		jnz	short no_rom_system_conf
  4726                                  
  4727                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4728                                  		; ds = cs
  4729 0000182C 268A4702                		mov	al, [es:bx+2]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_modelbyte]
  4730 00001830 A2[3E06]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  4731                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al
  4732                                  					; get/save model byte
  4733 00001833 268A4703                		mov	al, [es:bx+3]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte]
  4734 00001837 A2[3F06]                		mov	[secondary_model_byte], al
  4735                                  		;mov	[cs:secondary_model_byte], al
  4736                                  					; get/save secondary model byte
  4737 0000183A EB0C                    		jmp	short turn_timer_on
  4738                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4739                                  
  4740                                  no_rom_system_conf:			
  4741 0000183C BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh
  4742 0000183F 8EC6                    		mov	es, si
  4743                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4744 00001841 26A00E00                		mov	al, [es:0Eh]	; get model byte (from 0FFFFh:0Eh)
  4745 00001845 A2[3E06]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  4746                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al ; save model byte
  4747                                  turn_timer_on:				
  4748 00001848 B020                    		mov	al, 20h	; ' '   ; turn on the timer
  4749 0000184A E620                    		out	20h, al		; Interrupt controller,	8259A.
  4750                                  					; AKPORT
  4751                                  
  4752                                  ; some olivetti m24 machines have an 8530 serial communications
  4753                                  ; chip installed at io address 50h and 52h. if we're running
  4754                                  ; on one of those, we must inhibit the normal aux port initialization
  4755                                  
  4756                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4757                                  		; ds = cs
  4758 0000184C 803E[3E06]00            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0
  4759                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:model_byte], 0 ; next to last	byte in	rom bios
  4760 00001851 7510                    		jnz	short not_olivetti_m24 ; skip for all other machines
  4761                                  					; (except olivetti m24)
  4762 00001853 E466                    		in	al, 66h		; is 8530 installed?
  4763 00001855 A820                    		test	al, 20h
  4764 00001857 740A                    		jz	short not_olivetti_m24 ; we're done if not
  4765 00001859 B00F                    		mov	al, 0Fh		; double check
  4766 0000185B E650                    		out	50h, al
  4767 0000185D E450                    		in	al, 50h
  4768 0000185F A801                    		test	al, 1		; this test was	copied from olivetti
  4769 00001861 7414                    		jz	short skip_aux_port_init ; take	this branch if 8530 installed
  4770                                  
  4771                                  not_olivetti_m24:			
  4772 00001863 B003                    		mov	al, 3		; init com4
  4773 00001865 E80809                  		call	aux_init
  4774 00001868 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; init com3
  4775 0000186A E80309                  		call	aux_init
  4776 0000186D B001                    		mov	al, 1		; init com2
  4777 0000186F E8FE08                  		call	aux_init
  4778 00001872 30C0                    		xor	al, al		; init com1
  4779 00001874 E8F908                  		call	aux_init
  4780                                  
  4781                                  skip_aux_port_init:			
  4782 00001877 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; init lpt3
  4783 00001879 E8EC08                  		call	print_init
  4784 0000187C B001                    		mov	al, 1		; init lpt2
  4785 0000187E E8E708                  		call	print_init
  4786 00001881 30C0                    		xor	al, al		; init lpt1
  4787 00001883 E8E208                  		call	print_init
  4788                                  		
  4789 00001886 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx ; 0
  4790 00001888 8EDA                    		mov	ds, dx		; to initialize	print screen vector
  4791 0000188A 8EC2                    		mov	es, dx
  4792 0000188C 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax
  4793                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4794 0000188E BF3405                  		mov	di, INITSPOT	; 0534h
  4795                                  		;mov	di, 534h	; INITSPOT (0000h:0534h)
  4796                                  					; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4797 00001891 AB                      		stosw
  4798 00001892 AB                      		stosw
  4799 00001893 8CC8                    		mov	ax, cs		; fetch	segment
  4800 00001895 C7066C00[EE06]          		mov	word [BRKADR], cbreak
  4801                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:6Ch, offset	cbreak ; [BRKADR]
  4802                                  					; break	entry point
  4803 0000189B A36E00                  		mov	[BRKADR+2], ax		
  4804                                  		;mov	ds:6Eh,	ax	; vector for break
  4805 0000189E C706A400[6207]          		mov	word [CHROUT*4], outchr
  4806                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:0A4h, offset outchr	; [CHROUT*4]
  4807 000018A4 A3A600                  		mov	[CHROUT*4+2], ax
  4808                                  		;mov	ds:0A6h, ax	; [CHROUT*4+2]
  4809 000018A7 BF0400                  		mov	di, 4
  4810 000018AA BB[F406]                		mov	bx, intret ; 19/10/2022
  4811                                  		;mov	bx, offset intret ; intret (cs:intret)
  4812                                  					; will initialize rest of interrupts
  4813 000018AD 93                      		xchg	ax, bx
  4814 000018AE AB                      		stosw			; location 4
  4815 000018AF 93                      		xchg	ax, bx		; cs:
  4816 000018B0 AB                      		stosw			; int 1	; location 6
  4817 000018B1 83C704                  		add	di, 4
  4818 000018B4 93                      		xchg	ax, bx
  4819 000018B5 AB                      		stosw			; location 12

  4826 000018BC 89160005                		mov	[0500h], dx
  4827                                  		;mov	ds:500h, dx	; set print screen & break = 0
  4828 000018C0 89160405                		mov	[LSTDRV], dx	; [0504h]
  4829                                  		;mov	ds:504h, dx	; clean	out last drive spec
  4830                                  
  4831                                  ; we need to initalize the cs:motorstartup variable from the disk
  4832                                  ; parameter table at sec9. the offsets in this table are defined in
  4833                                  ; the disk_parms struc in msdskprm.inc. 2 locs

  4837                                  					; [522h+0Ah]
  4838                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4839                                  		; ds = 0
  4840                                  
  4841 000018C7 2EA2[2601]              		mov	[cs:motorstartup], al

  5062                                  ;

  5082                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5083                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5084                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5085                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5086                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5087                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5088                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5089                                  ; the bds for harddrives.

  5404                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what

  5409                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5410                                  ;
  5411                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5412                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5413                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5414                                  ;use to start with.

  5416                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5417                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine

  5419                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5420                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.

  5493                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5494                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5495                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5496                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5497                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5498                                  ; off of it.

  5501                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5502                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5503                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide

  5717                                  	;	;sub	es:16D8h, ax

  5719                                  	;				; need a logical sector number that will

  5735                                  					; need a logical sector number that will
  5736                                  					; be used by getclus(diskrd procedure)

  5739                                  	; ------

  5753                                  loadit:

  5781                                  
  5782                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  5783                                  ;
  5784                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  5785                                  
  5786                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  5787                                  
  5788                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5789                                  ; module name: remap
  5790                                  ;
  5791                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  5792                                  ;
  5793                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  5794                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  5795                                  ;
  5796                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  5797                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  5798                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5799                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5800                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5801                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5802                                  
  5803                                  ; input:       none
  5804                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  5805                                  ; exit error:  none
  5806                                  ; called from: msinit
  5807                                  ;
  5808                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  5809                                  ;	  found in the system
  5810                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  5811                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  5812                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  5813                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  5814                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  5815                                  ;
  5816                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5817                                  
  5818                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5819                                  ; 02/10/2022
  5820                                  
  5821                                  remap:		; proc near		
  5822 00001C77 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  5823                                  
  5824                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  5825                                  
  5826                                  drive_loop:				
  5827 00001C7C 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5828                                  					; first	hard disk??
  5829 00001C80 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  5830 00001C82 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5831                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  5832 00001C84 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1		; last bds?
  5833 00001C87 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  5834 00001C89 EB4F                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  5835                                  
  5836                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5837                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  5838                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  5839                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5840                                  
  5841                                  fdrv_found:				
  5842 00001C8B B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  5843                                  fdrv_loop:				
  5844 00001C8D 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5845                                  					; found	??
  5846 00001C90 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5847                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  5848                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  5849                                  		; 18/12/2022
  5850 00001C92 40                      		inc	ax
  5851 00001C93 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ??
  5852 00001C96 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk	drives
  5853                                  
  5854                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5855                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  5856                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  5857                                  ; any more.
  5858                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5859                                  
  5860 00001C98 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  5861                                  					; get first bds
  5862 00001C9D 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5863                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  5864 00001C9F 2E8A26[2501]            		mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  5865 00001CA4 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  5866                                  remap_loop1:				
  5867 00001CA7 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5868                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  5869 00001CA9 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5870 00001CAC FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  5871 00001CAE FECC                    		dec	ah		; count	down extra floppies
  5872 00001CB0 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  5873                                  
  5874                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  5875                                  
  5876 00001CB2 2EA0[CA16]              		mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  5877 00001CB6 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  5878 00001CB8 7220                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  5879 00001CBA 2E2A06[2501]            		sub	al, [cs:dsktnum] ; is it one of the other floppies?
  5880 00001CBF 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  5881                                  
  5882                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  5883                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  5884                                  
  5885 00001CC1 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  5886 00001CC3 EB05                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  5887                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5888                                  
  5889                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  5890                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  5891                                  
  5892                                  remap_boot_flop:			
  5893 00001CC5 2E0206[7500]            		add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  5894                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  5895 00001CCA 2EA2[CA16]              		mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  5896 00001CCE FEC0                    		inc	al
  5897 00001CD0 1E                      		push	ds
  5898 00001CD1 BF5804                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  5899                                  		;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  5900 00001CD4 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  5901 00001CD6 A2[9602]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  5902                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  5903                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  5904 00001CD9 1F                      		pop	ds
  5905                                  rmap_exit:				
  5906 00001CDA C3                      		retn
  5907                                  
  5908                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5909                                  
  5910                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5911                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  5912                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  5913                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  5914                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  5915                                  ;**************************************************
  5916                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  5917                                  ;
  5918                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  5919                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  5920                                  ;
  5921                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  5922                                  ;**************************************************
  5923                                  
  5924                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5925                                  bootbias equ 200h
  5926                                  
  5927                                  getboot:	; proc near		
  5928                                  		
  5929                                  		; 08/04/2018
  5930                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  5931                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  5932                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5933                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  5934                                  
  5935 00001CDB 2EA1[D516]              		mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  5936 00001CDF 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  5937                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5938 00001CE1 BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  5939                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  5940                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  5941 00001CE4 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  5942 00001CE7 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  5943 00001CE9 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  5944 00001CEC CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  5945                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  5946                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  5947                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  5948 00001CEE 7209                    		jb	short erret
  5949                                  		; 17/10/2022
  5950 00001CF0 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  5951                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  5952                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  5953 00001CF7 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  5954                                  erret:					
  5955 00001CF9 F9                      		stc
  5956                                  norm_ret:				
  5957 00001CFA C3                      		retn
  5958                                  
  5959                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  5960                                  
  5961                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  5962                                  
  5963                                  ;***************************************************************************
  5964                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  5965                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  5966                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  5967                                  ;   determine version number
  5968                                  ;
  5969                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  5970                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  5971                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  5972                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  5973                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  5974                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  5975                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  5976                                  ;***************************************************************************
  5977                                  
  5978                                  sethard:	; proc near		
  5979 00001CFB 57                      		push	di
  5980 00001CFC 53                      		push	bx
  5981 00001CFD 1E                      		push	ds
  5982 00001CFE 06                      		push	es
  5983 00001CFF 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5984 00001D02 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5985 00001D05 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  5986                                  					; fnon_removable
  5987 00001D09 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  5988                                  					; ffHardFile
  5989 00001D0D C606[D216]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  5990 00001D12 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  5991 00001D14 52                      		push	dx
  5992 00001D15 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  5993 00001D17 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  5994                                  					; DL = drive number
  5995                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  5996                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  5997                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  5998 00001D19 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  5999 00001D1B 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  6000 00001D1E 5A                      		pop	dx
  6001 00001D1F 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  6002 00001D21 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  6003 00001D24 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6004 00001D27 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  6005 00001D28 E8B0FF                  		call	getboot
  6006 00001D2B 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  6007 00001D2C 7256                    		jb	short setret
  6008 00001D2E BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6009                                  
  6010                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  6011                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  6012                                  
  6013                                  act_part:				
  6014 00001D31 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  6015 00001D36 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  6016 00001D38 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  6017 00001D3C 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6018 00001D3E 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6019 00001D42 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6020 00001D44 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6021 00001D48 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  6022                                  got_good_act:				
  6023 00001D4A 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  6024 00001D4C 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  6025 00001D4E FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  6026                                  no_act:					
  6027 00001D50 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6028 00001D53 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6029                                  					; last entry done?
  6030 00001D57 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6031 00001D59 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6032                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6033                                  
  6034                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6035                                  
  6036                                  get_primary:				
  6037 00001D5C 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6038 00001D61 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6039                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6040 00001D63 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6041 00001D67 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  6042 00001D69 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6043 00001D6D 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  6044 00001D6F 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6045 00001D73 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  6046                                  got_prim:				
  6047 00001D75 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6048 00001D77 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6049 00001D79 FECE                    		dec	dh
  6050                                  not_prim:				
  6051 00001D7B 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6052 00001D7E 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6053 00001D82 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6054                                  setret:					
  6055 00001D84 F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6056 00001D85 E9E002                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6057                                  
  6058                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6059                                  
  6060                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6061                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6062                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6063                                  ;
  6064                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6065                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6066                                  ;  without change.
  6067                                  ;
  6068                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6069                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6070                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6071                                  
  6072                                  set2:

  6074                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  6075 00001D8D 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  6076 00001D91 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  6077                                  
  6078                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  6079                                  ; sectors should be allowed

  6082 00001D98 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0

  6084 00001D9F 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  6085 00001DA3 7305                    		jnb	short okdrive
  6086 00001DA5 800E[D216]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  6087                                  okdrive:

  6089 00001DAE 894517                  		mov	[di+17h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6090                                  					; BPB_HIDDENSECTORS = p->partitionbegin
  6091 00001DB1 268B4706                		mov	ax, [es:bx+6]

  6094 00001DBC 268B4708                		mov	ax, [es:bx+8]	; # of sectors (low)

  6096 00001DC3 89451B                  		mov	[di+1Bh], ax	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6097                                  					; bpb->maxsec =	p->partitionlength

  6100 00001DCB 83F840                  		cmp	ax, 64		; if (p->partitionlength < 64)
  6101 00001DCE 72B4                    		jb	short setret	; return -1;
  6102                                  okdrive_1:

  6104 00001DD3 8B4517                  		mov	ax, [di+17h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6105 00001DD6 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; boot sector number - for mini	disk
  6106                                  					; usually equal	to the # of sec/trk.
  6107 00001DD8 8A5D13                  		mov	bl, [di+13h]	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6108 00001DDB 50                      		push	ax

  6110 00001DDE 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6111 00001DE0 F7F3                    		div	bx		; (sectors)dx:ax / (BDS.secpertrack)bx =
  6112                                  					; (track)temp_h:ax + (sector)dx
  6113                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6114 00001DE2 2EA3[2905]              		mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6115 00001DE6 58                      		pop	ax

  6117 00001DE9 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  6118 00001DEB FEC1                    		inc	cl
  6119 00001DED 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  6120 00001DEF 8A5D15                  		mov	bl, [di+15h]	; [di+BDS.heads]
  6121 00001DF2 50                      		push	ax
  6122 00001DF3 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6123 00001DF5 2EA1[2905]              		mov	ax, [cs:temp_h]

  6130 00001E0A 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024
  6131 00001E0D 7777                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6132                                  			; Retro DOS v3.2 note by Erdogan Tan - 28/07/2019
  6133                                  			; **MSDOS code accepts if ax = 1024 but it is nonsense here
  6134                                  			; ('ja' must be 'jnb')
  6135                                  okdrive_2:
  6136                                   		; 28/07/2019
  6137                                  ; dl is head.
  6138                                  ; ax is cylinder
  6139                                  ; cl is sector number (assume less than 2**6 = 64 for int 13h)
  6140                                  
  6141                                  ;*** for mini disks ***
  6142

  6144                                  					; check	for mini disk

  6146 00001E15 034549                  		add	ax, [di+49h]	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  6147                                  					; set the physical track number

  6149                                  ;*** end of added logic for mini disk
  6150

  6152 00001E1A D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; two bits of upper byte
  6153 00001E1C 80E4C0                  		and	ah, 0C0h	; turn off remainder of	bits
  6154 00001E1F 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; move two bits	to correct spot
  6155 00001E21 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch is	cylinder (low 8	bits)
  6156                                  					; cl is	sector + 2 high	bits of	cylinder
  6157 00001E23 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl		; dh is	head
  6158 00001E25 2E8A16[D716]            		mov	dl, [cs:rom_drv_num] ; dl is drive number
  6159                                  
  6160                                  ; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6161                                  ; ch is low 8 bits of cylinder
  6162                                  ; dh is head
  6163                                  ; dl is drive
  6164                                  
  6165                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6166                                  ; into cs:disksector area.
  6167                                  
  6168                                  ; read in boot sector using bios disk interrupt. the buffer where it
  6169                                  ; is to be read in is cs:disksector.
  6170                                  
  6171 00001E2A 0E                      		push	cs
  6172 00001E2B 07                      		pop	es
  6173 00001E2C BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; for convenience,
  6174                                  					; we are going to read the logical boot	sector
  6175                                  					; into cs:disksector area.
  6176 00001E2F B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6177 00001E32 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6178                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6179                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6180                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6181                                  
  6182                                  ; cs:disksec contains the boot sector. in theory, (ha ha) the bpb in this thing
  6183                                  ; is correct. we can, therefore, suck out all the relevant statistics on the
  6184                                  ; media if we recognize the version number.
  6185                                  
  6186 00001E34 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
  6187 00001E37 53                      		push	bx
  6188 00001E38 50                      		push	ax
  6189 00001E39 2E803FE9                		cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0E9h ; is it a near jump?
  6190 00001E3D 740D                    		jz	short check_1_ok ; yes
  6191 00001E3F 2E803FEB                		cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0EBh ; is it a short jump?
  6192 00001E43 7529                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no
  6193 00001E45 2E807F0290              		cmp	byte [cs:bx+2], 90h ; yes, is the next one a nop?
  6194 00001E4A 7522                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record
  6195                                  check_1_ok:				
  6196 00001E4C BB5901                  		mov	bx, 159h	; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6197                                  					; point	to the bpb in the boot record
  6198 00001E4F 2E8A470A                		mov	al, [cs:bx+10]	; [bx+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  6199                                  					; get the mediadescriptor byte
  6200 00001E53 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h	; mask off low nibble
  6201 00001E55 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; is high nibble = 0Fh?
  6202 00001E57 7515                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no,	invalid	boot record
  6203 00001E59 2E813F0002              		cmp	word [cs:bx], 512 ; [bx+EBPB.BYTESPERSECTOR]
  6204 00001E5E 750E                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; invalidate non 512 byte sectors
  6205                                  
  6206                                  check2_ok:				; yes, mediadescriptor ok.
  6207 00001E60 2E8A4702                		mov	al, [cs:bx+2]	; now make sure	that
  6208                                  					; the sectorspercluster	is
  6209                                  					; a power of 2
  6210                                  					;
  6211                                  					; [bx+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  6212                                  					; get the sectorspercluster
  6213 00001E64 08C0                    		or	al, al		; is it	zero?
  6214 00001E66 7406                    		jz	short invalid_boot_record ; yes, invalid boot record
  6215                                  
  6216                                  ck_power_of_two:			
  6217 00001E68 D0E8                    		shr	al, 1		; shift	until first bit	emerges
  6218 00001E6A 73FC                    		jnb	short ck_power_of_two
  6219 00001E6C 7405                    		jz	short valid_boot_record

  6221                                  invalid_boot_record:

  6223 00001E6F 5B                      		pop	bx
  6224 00001E70 E93301                  		jmp	unknown		; jump to invalid boot record
  6225                                  					; unformatted or illegal media.
  6226                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6227

  6229 00001E73 58                      		pop	ax

  6231

  6280                                  copybpb:
  6281                                  
  6282                                  ; 03/10/2022
  6283                                  
  6284                                  ; we have a valid boot sector. use the bpb in it to build the
  6285                                  ; bpb in bios. it is assumed that only
  6286                                  ;	BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER
  6287                                  ;	BDS_BPB.BPB_ROOTENTRIES, and
  6288                                  ;	BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERFAT

  6290                                  
  6291                                  ; if it is non fat based system, then just copy the bpb from the boot sector
  6292                                  ; into the bpb in bds table, and also set the boot serial number, volume id,
  6293                                  ; and system id according to the boot record.
  6294                                  ; for the non_fat system, don't need to set the other value. so just do goodret.

  6424                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6425                                  		;mov	si, disksector+11
  6426                                  		;;mov	si, 159h	; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6427                                  					; cs:si	-> bpb in boot

  6430                                  					; get totsec from boot sec

  6439                                  		; CL = number of FATs (2 or 1)

  6441 00001F25 09C3                    		or	bx, ax
  6442 00001F27 7508                    		jnz	short copy_totsec
  6443                                  			; screw it. it	was bogus.
  6444 00001F29 8B451B                  		mov	ax, [di+1Bh]	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]

  6446 00001F2F EB06                    		jmp	short fat_big_small
  6447                                  
  6448                                  		;mov	cx, dx
  6449                                  		;or	cx, ax		; see if it is a big zero

  6500                                  					; # of data sectors

  6503                                  					; sectors per cluster

  6505                                  					; set in bios bpb

  6598                                  					; if (fbigfat)
  6599 00001FE5 751E                    		jnz	short dobig	; goto dobig; (16 bit fat)
  6600                                  
  6601                                  ; we don't need to change "small fat" logic since it is gauranteed
  6602                                  ; that double word total sector will not use 12 bit fat (unless
  6603                                  ; it's sectors/cluster >= 16 which will never be in this case.)
  6604                                  ; so in this case we assume dx = 0 !!
  6605                                  
  6606 00001FE7 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; (12 bit fat)
  6607 00001FE9 88EB                    		mov	bl, ch
  6608 00001FEB 4B                      		dec	bx
  6609 00001FEC 01C3                    		add	bx, ax		; dx=0
  6610 00001FEE D3EB                    		shr	bx, cl		; bx = 1+(bpb->maxsec+BDS.secperclus-1)/
  6611 00001FF0 43                      		inc	bx		; BDS.secperclus
  6612 00001FF1 80E3FE                  		and	bl, 0FEh	; bx &= ~1; (=number of clusters)
  6613 00001FF4 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
  6614 00001FF6 D1EB                    		shr	bx, 1
  6615 00001FF8 01F3                    		add	bx, si
  6616 00001FFA 81C3FF01                		add	bx, 511		; bx +=	511 + bx/2
  6617 00001FFE D0EF                    		shr	bh, 1		; bh >>= 1; (=bx/512)
  6618 00002000 887D11                  		mov	[di+11h], bh	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  6619                                  					; save number of fat sectors
  6620 00002003 EB3D                    		jmp	short massage_bpb
  6621                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6622                                  
  6623                                  ; for bigfat we do need to extend this logic to 32 bit sector calculation.
  6624                                  
  6625                                  dobig:					
  6626 00002005 B104                    		mov	cl, 4		; 16 (2^4) directory entries per sector
  6627 00002007 52                      		push	dx		; save total sectors (high)
  6628 00002008 8B550C                  		mov	dx, [di+0Ch]	; [di+BDS.direntries]
  6629 0000200B D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl		; root dir sectors = BDS.direntries / 16;
  6630 0000200D 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx
  6631 0000200F 5A                      		pop	dx
  6632 00002010 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= total	sectors	- root dir sectors
  6633 00002013 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6634 00002016 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= t - r	- d
  6635                                  					; total	secs - reserved	secs - root dir	secs
  6636 00002019 B302                    		mov	bl, 2
  6637 0000201B 8A7D08                  		mov	bh, [di+8]	; [di+BDS.secperclus]
  6638                                  					; bx = 256 * BDS.secperclus + 2
  6639                                  
  6640                                  ; I don't understand why to add bx here!!!
  6641                                  
  6642                                  		; 29/12/2018 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.0)
  6643                                  		; 27/09/2022
  6644                                  		; (Microsoft FAT32 File	System Specification,
  6645                                  		; December 2000, Page 21)
  6646                                  		; TmpVal1 = DskSize - (BPB_ResvdSecCnt+RootrDirSectors)
  6647                                  		; TmpVal2 = (256*BPB_SecPerClus)+BPB_NumFATs
  6648                                  		; FATsz	= (TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1))/TmpVal2
  6649                                  		; (If FATType == FAT16,	BPB_FATSz16 = LOWORD(FATSz))
  6650                                  		
  6651 0000201E 01D8                    		add	ax, bx		; ax = t-r-d+256*spc+2
  6652 00002020 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  6653 00002023 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1		; ax = t-r-d+256*spc+1
  6654 00002026 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6655                                  
  6656                                  ; assuming dx in the table will never be bigger than bx.
  6657                                  
  6658 00002029 F7F3                    		div	bx		; BDS.fatsecs =
  6659                                  					; ceil((total-dir-res)/(256*BDS.secperclus+2))
  6660 0000202B 894511                  		mov	[di+11h], ax	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  6661                                  					; number of fat	sectors
  6662                                  
  6663                                  ; now, set the default filesys_id, volume label, serial number
  6664                                  
  6665                                  		;mov	bl, ds:fbigfat
  6666                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6667 0000202E 8A1E[D216]              		mov	bl, [fbigfat]
  6668 00002032 885D1F                  		mov	[di+1Fh], bl	; [di+BDS.fatsiz] ; fat	size flag
  6669                                  
  6670 00002035 1E                      		push	ds
  6671 00002036 1E                      		push	ds
  6672 00002037 07                      		pop	es
  6673 00002038 0E                      		push	cs
  6674 00002039 1F                      		pop	ds

  6676 0000203A BD[CC05]                		mov	bp, CLEARIDS
  6677                                  		;mov	bp, 5D9h	; clear_ids
  6678                                  					; at 2C7h:5D9h = 70h:2B49h
  6679 0000203D 0E                      		push	cs
  6680 0000203E E824F7                  		call	call_bios_code
  6681 00002041 1F                      		pop	ds
  6682                                  
  6683                                  ; at this point, in bpb of bds table, BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS which is
  6684                                  ; set according to the partition information. we are going to
  6685                                  ; see if (hidden sectors + total sectors) > a word. if it is true,
  6686                                  ; then no change. otherwise, BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be moved
  6687                                  ; to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be set to 0.
  6688                                  ; we don't do this for the bpb information from the boot record. we
  6689                                  ; are not going to change the bpb information from the boot record.
  6690                                  
  6691                                  massage_bpb:
  6692                                  		; 12/12/2022
  6693 00002042 8A1E[D216]              		mov	bl, [fbigfat]

  6695                                  					; set size of fat on media
  6696                                  		;
  6697 00002049 8B551D                  		mov	dx, [di+1Dh]	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]

  6740                                  ;instead, sometimes fdisk use 10000h to calculate the maximum number.

  6784                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6785                                  
  6786                                  ; 15/10/2022
  6787                                  
  6788                                  ; setdrvparms sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the system based on
  6789                                  ; the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the various form factors
  6790                                  ; are present in the bpbtable. for hard files, the recommended bpb is the same
  6791                                  ; as the bpb on the drive.
  6792                                  ;
  6793                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
  6794                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
  6795                                  
  6796                                  setdrvparms:
  6797 000020B3 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  6798                                  		; 18/10/2022
  6799 000020B5 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds in list
  6800                                  _next_bds:				
  6801 000020B9 06                      		push	es
  6802 000020BA 57                      		push	di
  6803 000020BB 268A5D22                		mov	bl, [es:di+22h]	; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
  6804 000020BF 80FB05                  		cmp	bl, 5		; ffHardFile
  6805 000020C2 753E                    		jnz	short nothardff
  6806 000020C4 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6807 000020C6 268B450E                		mov	ax, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
  6808 000020CA 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
  6809 000020CC 7508                    		jnz	short get_ccyl
  6810 000020CE 268B551D                		mov	dx, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6811 000020D2 268B451B                		mov	ax, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6812                                  
  6813                                  get_ccyl:

  6815 000020D7 50                      		push	ax
  6816 000020D8 268B4515                		mov	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
  6817 000020DC 26F76513                		mul	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6818                                  					; assume sectors per cyl. < 64k.
  6819 000020E0 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax		; cx has # sectors per cylinder
  6820 000020E2 58                      		pop	ax
  6821 000020E3 5A                      		pop	dx		; dx:ax	= total	sectors
  6822 000020E4 50                      		push	ax
  6823 000020E5 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  6824 000020E7 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6825 000020E9 F7F1                    		div	cx
  6826 000020EB 2EA3[2905]              		mov	[cs:temp_h], ax	; ax be	0 here.
  6827 000020EF 58                      		pop	ax
  6828 000020F0 F7F1                    		div	cx		; div #sec by sec/cyl to get # cyl.
  6829 000020F2 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
  6830 000020F4 7401                    		jz	short no_cyl_rnd ; came out even
  6831 000020F6 40                      		inc	ax		; round	up
  6832                                  
  6833                                  no_cyl_rnd:				
  6834 000020F7 26894525                		mov	[es:di+25h], ax	; [es:di+BDS.cylinders]
  6835 000020FB 06                      		push	es
  6836 000020FC 1F                      		pop	ds
  6837 000020FD 8D7506                  		lea	si, [di+6]	; [di+BDS.bytespersec]
  6838                                  					; ds:si	-> bpb for hard	file
  6839 00002100 EB51                    		jmp	short set_recbpb
