  9617                                  
  9618                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9619                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
  9620                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
  9621                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
  9622                                  ;	    for all other cases,
  9623                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
  9624                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
  9625                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
  9626                                  ;
  9627                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
  9628                                  ;
  9629                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
  9630                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
  9631                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
  9632                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
  9633                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
  9634                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
  9635                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
  9636                                  ;
  9637                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
  9638                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
  9639                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
  9640                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9641                                  
  9642                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
  9643                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable		
  9644 000005F7 26F6452305              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 5

  9646 000005FE E99500                  		jmp	getret_exit

  9655                                  		; we assume that the 2.x and greater dos disks all
  9656                                  		; have a valid boot sector.
  9657

  9661 0000060B 7508                    		jnz	short dofatbpb

  9751                                  		; 18/12/2022
  9752 00000685 29C9                    		sub	cx, cx
  9753 00000687 26894D19                		mov	[es:di+19h], cx ; 0 ; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  9754 0000068B 26894D17                		mov	[es:di+17h], cx ; 0 ; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  9755 0000068F 26894D1D                		mov	[es:di+1Dh], cx ; 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  9756                                  getret:					
  9757 00000693 5B                      		pop	bx
  9758 00000694 5A                      		pop	dx
  9759 00000695 59                      		pop	cx
  9760                                  getret_exit:				
  9761 00000696 C3                      		retn
  9762                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9763                                  
  9764                                  getbp_err_ret:	; before doing anything else, set set_id_flag	to 0.			
  9765                                  		;mov	ds:set_id_flag,	0
  9766                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9767 00000697 C606[0A05]00            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 0
  9768 0000069C E83105                  		call	maperror
  9769 0000069F EBF2                    		jmp	short getret
  9770                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9771                                  
  9772                                  		; we have a 3.5" diskette for	which we cannot	build a	bpb.
  9773                                  		; we do	not assume any type of bpb for this medium.
  9774                                  
  9775                                  got_unknown_medium:			
  9776                                  		;mov	ds:set_id_flag,	0

  9778 000006A6 B007                    		mov	al, 7
  9779 000006A8 F9                      		stc

  9781                                  
  9782                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9783                                  
  9784                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9785                                  
  9786                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9787                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
  9788                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
  9789                                  ;
  9790                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
  9791                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9792                                  
  9793                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9794                                  
  9795                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
  9796                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE:06C3h)
  9797                                  
  9798                                  readbootsec:	
  9799 000006AB B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
  9800 000006AD B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
  9801 000006B0 E8C600                  		call	read_sector
  9802 000006B3 724A                    		jb	short err_ret
  9803 000006B5 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
  9804                                  
  9805                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
  9806                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
  9807                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
  9808                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
  9809                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
  9810                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
  9811                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
  9812                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
  9813                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
  9814                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
  9815                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
  9816                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
  9817                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
  9818                                  		; informations
  9819                                  
  9820                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
  9821                                  
  9822                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9823 000006B7 803E[4E01]69            		cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
  9824 000006BC 7415                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
  9825 000006BE 803E[4E01]E9            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
  9826 000006C3 740E                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
  9827 000006C5 803E[4E01]EB            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
  9828 000006CA 7531                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9829 000006CC 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
  9830 000006D1 752A                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9831                                  
  9832                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9833                                  ;
  9834                                  ;; 10/03/2019
  9835                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
  9836                                  ;;
  9837                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
  9838                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
  9839                                  ;;
  9840                                  ;;check_signature:
  9841                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
  9842                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
  9843                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
  9844                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
  9845                                  
  9846                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
  9847                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
  9848                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
  9849                                  
  9850                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9851                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:			
  9852 000006D3 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9853                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9854 000006D6 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
  9855 000006D8 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
  9856 000006DA 7521                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9857                                  
  9858                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
  9859                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
  9860                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
  9861                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
  9862                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
  9863                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
  9864                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
  9865                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
  9866                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
  9867                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
  9868                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
  9869                                  
  9870                                  checksinglesided:
  9871 000006DC A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9872 000006DF 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
  9873 000006E1 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
  9874 000006E3 A801                    		test	al, 1
  9875 000006E5 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
  9876 000006E7 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
  9877 000006ED 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
  9878 000006EF 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
  9879 000006F4 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
  9880                                  
  9881                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
  9882                                  
  9883                                  mustbeearlier:				
  9884 000006F6 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
  9885                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9886 000006FB EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
  9887                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9888                                  
  9889                                  invalidbootsec:				
  9890 000006FD 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
  9891                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9892                                  movbpb_ret:
  9893                                  gooddsk:				
  9894 000006FE F8                      		clc
  9895                                  err_ret:
  9896 000006FF C3                      		retn
  9897                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9898                                  
  9899                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9900                                  ;err_ret:				
  9901                                  		;retn
  9902                                  
  9903                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9904                                  
  9905                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9906                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9907                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
  9908                                  ; getbp routine at has1
  9909                                  ;
  9910                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
  9911                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
  9912                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
  9913                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
  9914                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
  9915                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
  9916                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9917                                  
  9918                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9919                                  
  9920                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9921                                  movbpb:	
  9922 00000700 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
  9923                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9924                                  					; sectors per unit
  9925 00000704 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
  9926                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
  9927                                  					; number of directory entries
  9928 00000708 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
  9929                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
  9930                                  					; size of drive
  9931 0000070C 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
  9932                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9933                                  					; media	descriptor
  9934 00000710 A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
  9935                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
  9936                                  					; number of fat	sectors
  9937 00000713 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
  9938                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
  9939                                  					; sectors per track
  9940 00000717 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
  9941                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
  9942                                  					; number of heads
  9943 0000071B 803E[0A05]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
  9944 00000720 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
  9945 00000722 E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
  9946 00000725 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
  9947 00000727 C606[0A05]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
  9948                                  movbpb_conv:				
  9949 0000072C 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
  9950 00000731 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
  9951 00000733 E8D411                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
  9952                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9953                                  		; cf = 0
  9954                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
  9955                                  		;clc
  9956 00000736 C3                      		retn
  9957                                  
  9958                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9959                                  
  9960                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
  9961                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
  9962                                  ;by es:di.
  9963                                  
  9964                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
  9965                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
  9966                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
  9967                                  ;      the boot record information.
  9968                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
  9969                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
  9970                                  
  9971                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9972                                  mov_media_ids:		
  9973 00000737 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
  9974                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
  9975                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
  9976 0000073C 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
  9977 0000073E 51                      		push	cx
  9978 0000073F 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
  9979                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
  9980 00000743 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
  9981 00000747 8B0E[7701]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
  9982                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
  9983 0000074B 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
  9984 0000074F 57                      		push	di
  9985 00000750 56                      		push	si
  9986 00000751 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
  9987 00000754 BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
  9988                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
  9989                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
  9990 00000757 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
  9991 0000075A F3A4                    		rep movsb
  9992                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
  9993                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9994 0000075C B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
  9995 0000075E BE[8401]                		mov	si, disksector+36h
  9996                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
  9997 00000761 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
  9998 00000764 F3A4                    		rep movsb
  9999 00000766 5E                      		pop	si
 10000 00000767 5F                      		pop	di
 10001 00000768 59                      		pop	cx
 10002                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10003                                  		; cf = 0
 10004                                  		;clc		; this clc is not required (16/06/2019 - Erdogan Tan)
 10005                                  				; (20/09/2022)
 10006 00000769 C3                      		retn
 10007                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10008                                  
 10009                                  mmi_not_ext:				
 10010 0000076A F9                      		stc
 10011 0000076B C3                      		retn

 10013                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10014                                  
 10015                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10016                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10017                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10018                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10019                                  ; output:
 10020                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10021                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
 10022                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10023                                  
 10024                                  readfat:	
 10025                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10026                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10027 0000076C 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10028 0000076E B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10029                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10030 00000771 E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10031 00000774 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
 10032 00000776 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
 10033                                  bad_fat_ret:				
 10034 00000778 C3                      		retn
 10035                                  
 10036                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10037                                  
 10038                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10039                                  
 10040                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10041                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10042                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10043                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10044                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10045                                  ;		dh has head
 10046                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10047                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10048                                  ;
 10049                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10050                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10051                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10052                                  ;
 10053                                  ;		carry set
 10054                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10055                                  ;
 10056                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10057                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10058                                  
 10059                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10060                                  
 10061                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10062                                  read_sector:	
 10063 00000779 55                      		push	bp
 10064 0000077A BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10065 0000077D 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10066 00000781 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10067                                  rd_ret:					
 10068 00000784 06                      		push	es
 10069 00000785 1E                      		push	ds
 10070 00000786 07                      		pop	es
 10071 00000787 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10072 0000078A CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10073                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10074                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10075                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10076 0000078C 07                      		pop	es
 10077 0000078D 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10078                                  rd_rty:					
 10079 0000078F E87604                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10080 00000792 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10081 00000794 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10082                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10083                                  					; fnon_removable
 10084 00000799 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10085 0000079B 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10086 000007A0 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10087 000007A2 50                      		push	ax
 10088 000007A3 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10089 000007A4 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10090                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10091                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10092                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10093                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10094 000007A8 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10095 000007AA 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10096                                  		; 
 10097 000007AD 1F                      		pop	ds
 10098 000007AE A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10099 000007B1 58                      		pop	ax
 10100                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10101 000007B2 06                      		push	es
 10102 000007B3 1E                      		push	ds
 10103 000007B4 07                      		pop	es
 10104 000007B5 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10105 000007B8 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10106                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10107                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10108                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10109 000007BA 07                      		pop	es
 10110 000007BB 9C                      		pushf
 10111 000007BC 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10112 000007C1 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10113 000007C3 50                      		push	ax
 10114 000007C4 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10115 000007C7 1E                      		push	ds
 10116 000007C8 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10117 000007CC 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10118 000007CF 1F                      		pop	ds
 10119 000007D0 58                      		pop	ax
 10120                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10121 000007D1 9D                      		popf
 10122 000007D2 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10123 000007D4 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10124                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10125                                  
 10126                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10127 000007D6 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10128                                  					; return error
 10129 000007D8 F9                      		stc
 10130                                  
 10131                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10132                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10133                                  
 10134                                  okret2:					
 10135 000007D9 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk
 10136 000007DD 8816[1E01]              		mov	[tim_drv], dl	; save drive last accessed
 10137 000007E1 26886D46                		mov	[es:di+46h], ch	; [es:di+BDS.track]
 10138                                  					; save last track accessed on this drive
 10139                                  					; preserve flags in case error occurred
 10140 000007E5 9C                      		pushf
 10141 000007E6 E8FF03                  		call	set_tim
 10142 000007E9 9D                      		popf			; restore flags
 10143 000007EA 5D                      		pop	bp
 10144 000007EB C3                      		retn
 10145                                  
 10146                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10147                                  ;	disk open/close routines
 10148                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10149                                  
 10150                                  dsk_open:				; 2C7h:80Ah = 70h:2D7Ah
 10151 000007EC 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 10152 000007F1 7407                    		jz	short dsk_open_exit ; done if no changeline support
 10153 000007F3 E8D5FC                  		call	SetDrive	; get bds for drive
 10154 000007F6 26FF4520                		inc	word [es:di+20h] ; [es:di+BDS.opcnt]
 10155                                  dsk_open_exit:	
 10156                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10157                                  		; cf = 0			
 10158                                  		;clc		; CF is	already	ZERO here (18/09/2022, MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10159                                  				; (19/07/2019 -	Erdogan	Tan - MSDOS 6.0	IO.SYS - retrodos4.s)
 10160 000007FA C3                      		retn
 10161                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10162                                  
 10163                                  dsk_close:				; 2C7h:81Ah = 70h:2D8Ah
 10164 000007FB 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0

 10234                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================

 10236                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10237                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10238                                  
 10239                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10240                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 10241                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10242                                  
 10243                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10244                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10245                                  ;
 10246                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 10247                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10248                                  
 10249                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10250                                  checksingle:		
 10251 0000083B 50                      		push	ax
 10252 0000083C 53                      		push	bx
 10253 0000083D 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10254                                  
 10255                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10256                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10257                                  
 10258 00000841 F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10259 00000844 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 10260 00000846 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 10261                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10262 00000849 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10263                                  
 10264                                  
 10265                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10266                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10267                                  
 10268 0000084B 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10269                                  					; get physical drive number
 10270 0000084F 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 10271 00000850 57                      		push	di
 10272 00000851 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10273                                  scan_list:				
 10274 00000855 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10275 00000859 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10276 0000085B B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10277 0000085D 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10278 00000861 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10279 00000863 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10280 00000867 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10281 00000868 07                      		pop	es
 10282 00000869 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10283                                  
 10284                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10285                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10286                                  ; in this case.
 10287 0000086D 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 10288 00000872 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 10289                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 10290 00000874 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 10291 00000879 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 10292 0000087B 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 10293                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 10294                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 10295 0000087F 06                      		push	es
 10296 00000880 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10297 00000884 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 10298                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10299                                  					; set up sdsb
 10300 00000888 07                      		pop	es		; restore bds pointer
 10301 00000889 EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 10302                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10303                                  
 10304                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 10305                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 10306                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 10307                                  
 10308                                  not_fsetowner:				
 10309 0000088B 803E[7800]02            		cmp	byte [single], 2 ; if (single_drive_system)
 10310 00000890 7517                    		jnz	short ignore_sdsb
 10311 00000892 50                      		push	ax
 10312 00000893 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 10313 00000897 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 10314 00000899 06                      		push	es
 10315 0000089A 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10316 0000089E 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]
 10317                                  		;xchg	al, es:504h	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10318                                  					; then swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10319 000008A3 07                      		pop	es
 10320 000008A4 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; else
 10321 000008A6 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10322 000008A7 7410                    		jz	short singleret	; issue	swap_dsk_msg
 10323                                  ignore_sdsb:				
 10324 000008A9 E8800E                  		call	swpdsk
 10325 000008AC EB0B                    		jmp	short singleret
 10326                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10327                                  
 10328                                  scan_skip:	
 10329 000008AE 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]			
 10330                                  		;les	di, es:[di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 10331                                  					; go to	next bds
 10332 000008B1 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; end of list?
 10333 000008B4 759F                    		jnz	short scan_list	; ontinue until	hit end	of list
 10334 000008B6 F9                      		stc
 10335 000008B7 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 10336 000008B8 07                      		pop	es
 10337                                  
 10338                                  singleret:				
 10339 000008B9 5B                      		pop	bx
 10340 000008BA 58                      		pop	ax
 10341 000008BB C3                      		retn

 10344

 10347 000008BE EB02                    		jmp	short baddrive_ret

 10349

 10360                                  
 10361                                  ; 15/10/52022
 10362                                  
 10363                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10364                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 10365                                  ;
 10366                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 10367                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 10368                                  ;	cx = sector count
 10369                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 10370                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 10371                                  ;	ds = cs
 10372                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 10373                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 10374                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 10375                                  ;
 10376                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 10377                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 10378                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10379                                  
 10380                                  diskrd:	
 10381                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 10382                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10383 000008C4 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2 ; romread
 10384                                  
 10385                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10386                                  
 10387                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10388                                  diskio:
 10389 000008C9 89FB                    		mov	bx, di		; es:bx	= transfer address
 10390 000008CB 8C06[3705]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es	; save transfer	segment
 10391 000008CF E8F9FB                  		call	SetDrive
 10392 000008D2 268A4510                		mov	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 10393 000008D6 A2[1F01]                		mov	[medbyt], al
 10394                                  		;jcxz	short ioret
 10395 000008D9 E3E8                    		jcxz	ioret
 10396                                  
 10397                                  ; see if the media is formatted or not by checking the flags field in
 10398                                  ; in the bds. if it is unformatted we cannot allow i/o, so we should
 10399                                  ; go to the error exit at label unformatteddrive.
 10400                                  
 10401 000008DB 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 2
 10402                                  		;test	byte ptr es:[di+24h], 2	; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 10403                                  					; unformatted_media
 10404 000008E0 75DE                    		jnz	short unformatteddrive
 10405 000008E2 890E[2201]              		mov	[seccnt], cx	; save sector count
 10406 000008E6 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; save sp
 10407                                  
 10408                                  ; ensure that we are trying to access valid sectors on the drive
 10409                                  
 10410 000008EA 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10411 000008EC 31F6                    		xor	si, si
 10412 000008EE 01CA                    		add	dx, cx
 10413 000008F0 83D600                  		adc	si, 0
 10414 000008F3 26837D0E00              		cmp	word [es:di+0Eh], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10415                                  					; > 32 bit sector ?
 10416 000008F8 740D                    		jz	short sanity32
 10417 000008FA 83FE00                  		cmp	si, 0
 10418 000008FD 75BD                    		jnz	short baddrive
 10419 000008FF 263B550E                		cmp	dx, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10420 00000903 77B7                    		ja	short baddrive
 10421 00000905 EB12                    		jmp	short sanityok
 10422                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10423                                  
 10424                                  sanity32:				
 10425 00000907 0336[2B05]              		add	si, [start_sec_h]
 10426 0000090B 263B751D                		cmp	si, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
 10427 0000090F 7208                    		jb	short sanityok
 10428 00000911 77A9                    		ja	short baddrive
 10429 00000913 263B551B                		cmp	dx, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
 10430 00000917 77A3                    		ja	short baddrive
 10431                                  
 10432                                  sanityok:				
 10433 00000919 8B16[2B05]              		mov	dx, [start_sec_h]
 10434 0000091D 26034517                		add	ax, [es:di+17h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs]
 10435 00000921 26135519                		adc	dx, [es:di+19h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
 10436                                  
 10437                                  ; now dx;ax have the physical first sector.
 10438                                  ; since the following procedures is going to destroy ax, let's
 10439                                  ; save it temporarily to saved_word.
 10440                                  
 10441 00000925 A3[2D05]                		mov	[saved_word], ax ; save the sector number (low)
 10442                                  
 10443                                  ; set up pointer to disk base table in [dpt]. we cannot assume that iosetup
 10444                                  ; will do it because we will skip the set up stuff with hard disks.
 10445                                  
 10446 00000928 06                      		push	es
 10447 00000929 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10448 0000092D 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]
 10449                                  		;les	si, es:78h	; [es:DSKADR]
 10450                                  					; current disk parm table
 10451 00000932 8936[2D01]              		mov	[dpt], si
 10452 00000936 8C06[2F01]              		mov	[dpt+2], es
 10453 0000093A 07                      		pop	es
 10454 0000093B 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10455                                  					; fnon_removable
 10456 00000940 7510                    		jnz	short skip_setup
 10457 00000942 E8F6FE                  		call	checksingle
 10458                                  
 10459                                  ; check to see if we have previously noted a change line. the routine
 10460                                  ; returns if everything is ok. otherwise, it pops off the stack and returns
 10461                                  ; the proper error code.
 10462                                  
 10463 00000945 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; do we have changeline support?
 10464 0000094A 7403                    		jz	short diskio_nochangeline ; brif not
 10465 0000094C E8AB0E                  		call	checklatchio	; will do a sneaky pop stack return
 10466                                  					; if a disk error occurs
 10467                                  diskio_nochangeline:			
 10468 0000094F E84700                  		call	iosetup		; set up tables	and variables for i/o
 10469                                  
 10470                                  ; now the settle values are correct for the following code
 10471                                  
 10472                                  skip_setup:
 10473                                  
 10474                                  ; 32 bit sector calculation.
 10475                                  ; dx:[saved_word] = starting sector number.
 10476                                  				
 10477 00000952 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10478 00000954 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10479 00000956 26F77513                		div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10480                                  					 ; divide by sec per track
 10481 0000095A A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10482 0000095D A1[2D05]                		mov	ax, [saved_word]
 10483 00000960 26F77513                		div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10484                                  					; now, [temp_h]:ax = track #, dx = sector
 10485                                  		;inc	dl		; sector number	is 1 based.
 10486                                  		; 18/12/2022
 10487 00000964 42                      		inc	dx
 10488 00000965 8816[3101]              		mov	[cursec], dl	; save current sector
 10489 00000969 268B4D15                		mov	cx, [es:di+15h]	; es:di+BDS.heads]
 10490                                  					; get number of	heads
 10491 0000096D 50                      		push	ax
 10492 0000096E 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10493 00000970 A1[2905]                		mov	ax, [temp_h]	; divide tracks	by heads per cylinder
 10494 00000973 F7F1                    		div	cx
 10495 00000975 A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10496 00000978 58                      		pop	ax
 10497 00000979 F7F1                    		div	cx		; now, [temp_h]:ax = cylinder #, dx = head
 10498 0000097B 833E[2905]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
 10499 00000980 7714                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg
 10500 00000982 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024	; 2^10 currently maxium	for track #.
 10501 00000985 770F                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg
 10502 00000987 8816[3201]              		mov	[curhd], dl	; save current head
 10503 0000098B A3[3301]                		mov	[curtrk], ax	; save current track
 10504                                  
 10505                                  ; we are now set up for the i/o. normally, we consider the dma boundary
 10506                                  ; violations here. not true. we perform the operation as if everything is
 10507                                  ; symmetric; let the int 13 handler worry about the dma violations.
 10508                                  
 10509 0000098E A1[2201]                		mov	ax, [seccnt]
 10510 00000991 E88400                  		call	block		; (cas - call/ret)
 10511                                  		;call	done
 10512                                  		;retn
 10513                                  		; 18/12/2022
 10514 00000994 EB4B                    		jmp	done
 10515

 10517                                  
 10518                                  baddrive_brdg:
