 13095                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13096                                  
 13097                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13098                                  
 13099                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13100                                  ;
 13101                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13102                                  ;
 13103                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13104                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13105                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13106                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13107                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13108                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13109                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13110                                  ;
 13111                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13112                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13113                                  ;
 13114                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13115                                  
 13116                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13117                                  HMAPtr:
 13118 000013C3 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13119                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13120 000013C8 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13121                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13122 000013CC 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13123 000013CF 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13124 000013D1 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13125                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13126 000013D6 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13127 000013D8 FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13128                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13129 000013DC 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13130                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13131                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13132 000013E0 C3                      		retn
 13133                                  
 13134                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13135                                  
 13136                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13137                                  
 13138                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13139                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13140                                  
 13141                                  move_sector:
 13142                                  
 13143                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13144                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13145                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13146                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13147                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13148                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13149                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13150                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13151                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13152                                  ;
 13153                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13154                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13155                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13156                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13157                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13158                                  
 13159 000013E1 FC                      		cld
 13160 000013E2 51                      		push	cx
 13161 000013E3 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13162 000013E6 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13163 000013EA 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13164 000013EC 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13165 000013F0 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13166 000013F2 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13167 000013F4 59                      		pop	cx
 13168 000013F5 C3                      		retn
 13169                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13170                                  
 13171                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13172 000013F6 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13173 000013F8 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13174 000013FA 59                      		pop	cx
 13175 000013FB C3                      		retn
 13176                                  
 13177                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13178                                  
 13179                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13180                                  
 13181                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13182                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13183                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13184                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13185                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13186                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13187                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13188                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13189                                  ;
 13190                                  ; input conditions:
 13191                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13192                                  ;
 13193                                  ; output:
 13194                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13195                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13196                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13197                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13198                                  
 13199                                  check_wrap:	
 13200 000013FC 50                      		push	ax
 13201 000013FD 53                      		push	bx
 13202 000013FE 06                      		push	es
 13203 000013FF 57                      		push	di
 13204 00001400 E86E00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13205 00001403 7260                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13206                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13207 00001405 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13208                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13209 0000140A 7459                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13210 0000140C 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13211 00001410 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13212 00001412 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13213 00001415 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13214 00001417 764C                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13215 00001419 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13216                                  
 13217                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13218                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13219                                  
 13220 0000141B 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13221 0000141D 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13222                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13223 0000141F 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13224 00001420 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13225                                  					; if on	boundary
 13226                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13227                                  not_on_bound:				
 13228 00001422 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13229 00001425 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13230 00001427 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13231 00001429 40                      		inc	ax
 13232 0000142A 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13233 0000142C 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13234 0000142F 263B4515                		cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13235                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13236 00001433 7636                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13237 00001435 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13238 00001436 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13239 00001438 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13240 0000143C F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13241                                  
 13242                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13243                                  
 13244 0000143E 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13245 00001440 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13246 00001442 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13247                                  
 13248                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13249                                  
 13250 00001444 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13251 00001446 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13252 00001448 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13253                                  no_head_bound:				
 13254 00001449 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13255 0000144B 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13256 0000144C FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13257 0000144E 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13258 00001450 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13259 00001452 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13260 00001455 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13261 00001457 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13262 00001459 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13263 0000145B 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13264 0000145D 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13265 0000145F D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13266 00001461 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13267 00001463 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13268                                  no_wrap:				
 13269 00001465 F8                      		clc
 13270 00001466 5F                      		pop	di
 13271 00001467 07                      		pop	es
 13272 00001468 5B                      		pop	bx
 13273 00001469 58                      		pop	ax
 13274 0000146A C3                      		retn
 13275                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13276                                  
 13277                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13278 0000146B 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13279 0000146D FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13280 0000146F EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13281                                  
 13282                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13283                                  
 13284                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13285                                  
 13286                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13287                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13288                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13289                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13290                                  ;
 13291                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13292                                  
 13293                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13294                                  find_bds:	
 13295 00001471 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13296                                  fbds_1:					
 13297 00001475 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13298 00001479 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13299 0000147B 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13300                                  					; go to next bds
 13301 0000147E 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13302 00001481 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13303 00001483 F9                      		stc
 13304                                  fdbs_2:					
 13305 00001484 C3                      		retn
 13306                                  
 13307                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13308                                  
 13309                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13310                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13311                                  doint:
 13312                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13313 00001485 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13314                                  					; get physical drive number
 13315                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13316                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13317                                  		
 13318 00001488 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13319 0000148A 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13320 0000148C 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13321                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13322 0000148E 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13323                                  					; get request code
 13324                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13325 00001491 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13326                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13327 00001494 9D                      		popf
 13328                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13329                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13330 00001495 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13331                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13332                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13333 0000149A 9C                      		pushf
 13334                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13335 0000149B 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13336                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13337                                  dointdone:				
 13338 0000149E C3                      		retn
 13339                                  
 13340                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13341                                  
 13342                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13343                                  
 13344                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13345                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13346                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13347                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13348                                  ;
 13349                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13350                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13351                                  ;
 13352                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13353                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13354                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13355                                  
 13356                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13357                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13358                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13359                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13360                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13361                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13362                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13363                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13364                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13365                                  ;end struc
 13366                                  
 13367                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13368                                  
 13369                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13370                                  ;	ah = function
 13371                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13372                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13373                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13374                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13375                                  ;   output conditions:
 13376                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13377                                  
 13378                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13379                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13380                                  ;
 13381                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13382                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13383                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13384                                  
 13385                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13386                                  
 13387                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13388                                  
 13389 0000149F 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13390                                  
 13391                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13392                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13393                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13394                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13395                                  
 13396                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13397                                  
 13398                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13399                                  
 13400                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13401                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13402                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13403                                  
 13404                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13405 000014A3 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13406 000014A8 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13407 000014AA 53                      		push	bx
 13408 000014AB BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13409 000014AE E83804                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13410 000014B1 5B                      		pop	bx
 13411 000014B2 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13412                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13413                                  
 13414                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13415                                  
 13416                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13417                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13418                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13419                                  
 13420                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13421                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13422 000014B4 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13423 000014B6 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13424 000014B8 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13425 000014B9 51                      		push	cx
 13426 000014BA 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13427 000014BC B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13428 000014BE D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13429 000014C0 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13430 000014C4 59                      		pop	cx
 13431 000014C5 58                      		pop	ax
 13432 000014C6 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13433                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13434 000014C8 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13435 000014C9 06                      		push	es
 13436                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13437 000014CA 2EC41E[9F14]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13438                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13439                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13440 000014CF 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13441 000014D1 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13442 000014D4 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13443                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13444                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13445 000014D8 07                      		pop	es
 13446 000014D9 5B                      		pop	bx
 13447 000014DA EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13448                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13449                                  
 13450                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13451                                  
 13452                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13453                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13454                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13455                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13456                                  
 13457                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13458 000014DC 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13459                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13460 000014E1 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13461 000014E3 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13462                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13463 000014E8 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13464                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13465 000014EA 50                      		push	ax
 13466 000014EB B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13467                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13468                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13469 000014ED 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13470                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13471                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13472 000014F2 58                      		pop	ax
 13473 000014F3 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13474                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13475                                  
 13476                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13477                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13478                                  
 13479                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13480                                  
 13481                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13482                                  
 13483                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13484                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13485                                  
 13486                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13487 000014F5 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13488                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13489                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13490 000014F6 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13491                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13492                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13493                                  
 13494                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13495                                  
 13496 000014FB A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13497 000014FE 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13498 00001501 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13499                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13500                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13501 00001503 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13502 00001508 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13503                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13504                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13505                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13506 0000150A 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13507                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13508                                  		
 13509 0000150F 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13510                                  		
 13511 00001510 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13512                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13513 00001515 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13514                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13515                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13516 00001517 9D                      		popf
 13517 00001518 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13518                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13519 0000151A 1F                      		pop	ds
 13520 0000151B CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13521                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13522                                  
 13523                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13524                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13525                                  ; a changeline error.
 13526                                  
 13527                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13528 0000151E 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13529                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13530 00001520 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13531 00001523 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13532 00001525 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13533 00001527 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13534 00001529 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13535 0000152E 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13536                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13537                                  					; never	would
 13538 00001530 53                      		push	bx
 13539 00001531 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13540 00001534 E8B203                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13541 00001537 5B                      		pop	bx
 13542                                  int13b:					
 13543 00001538 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13544 00001539 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13545                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13546                                  
 13547                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13548                                  
 13549                                  goterr13:				
 13550 0000153B 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13551 0000153E 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13552                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13553 00001540 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13554 00001543 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13555 00001545 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13556 0000154A 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13557                                  
 13558 0000154C 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13559                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13560                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13561                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13562 00001551 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13563                                  
 13564 00001553 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13565                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13566                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13567 00001555 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13568                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13569                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13570 0000155A A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13571 0000155D 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13572 0000155F 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13573 00001561 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13574 00001563 53                      		push	bx
 13575 00001564 51                      		push	cx
 13576 00001565 52                      		push	dx
 13577 00001566 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13578                                  loop_ecc:				
 13579 00001569 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13580                                  
 13581                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13582                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13583                                  ;
 13584                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13585                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13586                                  ; track.
 13587                                  ;
 13588                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13589                                  ; this request.
 13590                                  ;
 13591                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13592                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13593                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13594                                  ;
 13595 0000156C E88DFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13596                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13597                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13598 0000156F 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13599                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13600 00001574 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13601 00001576 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13602 00001579 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13603 0000157B 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13604 0000157E 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13605                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13606                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13607                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13608 00001580 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13609                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13610                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13611                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13612                                  ok11_op:				
 13613 00001582 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13614 00001586 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13615 00001588 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13616                                  					; add 200h to address
 13617 0000158A FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13618 0000158C FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13619 0000158E EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13620                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13621                                  
 13622                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13623                                  
 13624                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13625 00001590 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13626                                  ok11_exit:				
 13627 00001591 5A                      		pop	dx
 13628 00001592 59                      		pop	cx
 13629 00001593 5B                      		pop	bx
 13630 00001594 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13631                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13632                                  
 13633                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13634                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13635                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13636                                  
 13637                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13638 00001596 06                      		push	es
 13639 00001597 53                      		push	bx
 13640 00001598 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13641 0000159B 1E                      		push	ds
 13642 0000159C 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13643 0000159D B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13644                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13645                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13646 000015A0 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13647                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13648 000015A5 5B                      		pop	bx
 13649 000015A6 07                      		pop	es
 13650 000015A7 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13651 000015A9 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13652 000015AC 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13653                                  
 13654                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13655                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13656                                  
 13657                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13658 000015AE 56                      		push	si
 13659 000015AF 57                      		push	di
 13660 000015B0 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13661 000015B2 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13662 000015B5 E829FE                  		call	move_sector
 13663 000015B8 5F                      		pop	di
 13664 000015B9 5E                      		pop	si
 13665 000015BA EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13666                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13667                                  
 13668                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13669                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13670                                  
 13671                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13672 000015BC A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13673 000015BF FB                      		sti
 13674 000015C0 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13675 000015C3 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13676                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13677                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13678 000015C5 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13679 000015C8 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13680 000015CA 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13681 000015CD 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13682 000015CF 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13683                                  
 13684                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13685                                  
 13686                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13687                                  
 13688 000015D1 52                      		push	dx
 13689 000015D2 51                      		push	cx
 13690 000015D3 53                      		push	bx
 13691 000015D4 50                      		push	ax
 13692 000015D5 55                      		push	bp
 13693 000015D6 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 13694 000015D8 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 13695 000015DA D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13696 000015DC D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13697 000015DE D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13698 000015E0 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 13699 000015E2 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 13700 000015E4 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 13701                                  
 13702                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 13703                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 13704                                  
 13705 000015E8 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 13706 000015EA E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 13707                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13708                                  
 13709                                  no_skip_first:				
 13710 000015ED D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 13711 000015EF B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 13712 000015F1 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 13713                                  
 13714                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 13715                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 13716                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 13717                                  ;
 13718                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 13719                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 13720                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 13721                                  ; in error.
 13722                                  
 13723 000015F3 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 13724 000015F5 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 13725                                  
 13726                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 13727                                  
 13728 000015F7 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13729                                  					; set up head number
 13730 000015FA E888FE                  		call	doint
 13731 000015FD E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 13732                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13733                                  
 13734                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 13735 00001600 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 13736 00001602 F9                      		stc
 13737 00001603 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 13738                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 13739                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13740                                  
 13741                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 13742                                  
 13743                                  intverify:				
 13744 00001606 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 13745 00001607 53                      		push	bx
 13746 00001608 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 13747 00001609 07                      		pop	es
 13748                                  dosimple:				
 13749 0000160A BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13750                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 13751                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 13752                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13753 0000160D 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13754                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13755 00001612 5B                      		pop	bx
 13756 00001613 07                      		pop	es
 13757 00001614 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13758                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13759                                  
 13760                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 13761                                  
 13762                                  intformat:				
 13763 00001617 06                      		push	es
 13764 00001618 53                      		push	bx
 13765 00001619 56                      		push	si
 13766 0000161A 57                      		push	di
 13767 0000161B 1E                      		push	ds
 13768                                  
 13769                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 13770                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 13771                                  
 13772 0000161C 06                      		push	es
 13773 0000161D 1E                      		push	ds
 13774 0000161E 07                      		pop	es
 13775 0000161F 1F                      		pop	ds
 13776 00001620 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 13777 00001622 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 13778 00001625 E8B9FD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 13779 00001628 1F                      		pop	ds
 13780 00001629 5F                      		pop	di
 13781 0000162A 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 13782 0000162B EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 13783                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13784                                  
 13785                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 13786                                  ; the first block.
 13787                                  ;
 13788                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 13789                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 13790                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 13791                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 13792                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 13793                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 13794                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 13795                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 13796                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 13797                                  
 13798                                  doblock:
 13799                                  
 13800                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 13801                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 13802                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 13803                                  				
 13804 0000162D 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13805                                  					; get head #, drive #
 13806 00001630 51                      		push	cx
 13807 00001631 06                      		push	es
 13808 00001632 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13809                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 13810 00001633 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 13811 00001636 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13812                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13813 0000163A 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13814                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13815 0000163F 5F                      		pop	di
 13816 00001640 07                      		pop	es
 13817 00001641 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 13818 00001643 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 13819 00001645 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 13820 00001647 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13821                                  doblockflop:				
 13822 00001649 59                      		pop	cx
 13823                                  doblockcontinue:			
 13824 0000164A 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 13825 0000164C 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 13826 0000164E 50                      		push	ax
 13827 0000164F 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 13828 00001651 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 13829                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13830                                  
 13831                                  doblocklast:				
 13832 00001653 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 13833 00001655 50                      		push	ax
 13834                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 13835 00001656 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 13836 00001659 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 13837 0000165B 58                      		pop	ax
 13838 0000165C 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 13839                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 13840 0000165F 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 13841 00001661 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 13842 00001663 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 13843 00001665 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 13844 00001667 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 13845                                  					; then we are done already.
 13846 00001669 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 13847                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 13848 0000166B E88EFD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 13849 0000166E EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 13850                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13851                                  
 13852                                  bufferx:				
 13853 00001670 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13854                                  					; set up head number
 13855                                  buffer:					
 13856 00001673 53                      		push	bx
 13857 00001674 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13858 00001677 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 13859 0000167A 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 13860                                  					
 13861                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 13862                                  
 13863 0000167C 06                      		push	es
 13864 0000167D 1E                      		push	ds
 13865 0000167E 56                      		push	si
 13866 0000167F 57                      		push	di
 13867 00001680 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 13868 00001681 06                      		push	es
 13869 00001682 1F                      		pop	ds
 13870 00001683 07                      		pop	es
 13871 00001684 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 13872 00001687 57                      		push	di		; save it
 13873 00001688 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 13874 0000168A E854FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 13875 0000168D 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 13876                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 13877 0000168E 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 13878 0000168F 5E                      		pop	si
 13879 00001690 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 13880                                  
 13881                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 13882                                  
 13883 00001691 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13884                                  					; get drive number
 13885 00001693 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 13886 00001696 E863FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 13887                                  					;
 13888                                  					; ah is	function
 13889                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 13890                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 13891                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 13892                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 13893                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 13894 00001699 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 13895 0000169C 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 13896 0000169D 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 13897 0000169F EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 13898                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13899                                  
 13900                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 13901                                  
 13902                                  doread:					
 13903 000016A1 06                      		push	es
 13904 000016A2 53                      		push	bx
 13905 000016A3 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 13906 000016A4 07                      		pop	es
 13907 000016A5 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13908 000016A8 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 13909 000016AA 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13910                                  					; get drive number
 13911 000016AD E84CFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 13912                                  					; ah = function
 13913                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 13914                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 13915                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 13916 000016B0 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 13917 000016B3 5B                      		pop	bx
 13918 000016B4 07                      		pop	es
 13919 000016B5 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 13920 000016B7 56                      		push	si
 13921 000016B8 57                      		push	di
 13922 000016B9 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13923 000016BB BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13924 000016BE E820FD                  		call	move_sector
 13925 000016C1 5F                      		pop	di
 13926 000016C2 5E                      		pop	si
 13927                                  
 13928                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 13929                                  
 13930                                  dotail:					
 13931 000016C3 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 13932 000016C4 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 13933 000016C7 41                      		inc	cx
 13934 000016C8 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 13935 000016CB F8                      		clc
 13936 000016CC FEC8                    		dec	al
 13937 000016CE 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 13938                                  
 13939                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 13940                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 13941                                  
 13942 000016D0 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13943 000016D3 E826FD                  		call	check_wrap
 13944 000016D6 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 13945                                  
 13946                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 13947                                  
 13948                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 13949                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 13950                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 13951                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 13952                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 13953                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 13954                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 13955                                  
 13956                                  bad13:					
 13957 000016D9 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 13958 000016DB 5D                      		pop	bp
 13959 000016DC 5B                      		pop	bx
 13960 000016DD 5B                      		pop	bx
 13961 000016DE 59                      		pop	cx
 13962 000016DF 5A                      		pop	dx
 13963 000016E0 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 13964 000016E2 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 13965                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13966                                  
 13967                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 13968 000016E5 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 13969                                  
 13970                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13971                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13972                                  		;db 	0
 13973                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13974                                  
 13975                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 13976                                  
 13977                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13978

 13984                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13985                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 13986 000016E8 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 13987 000016EC BF[8706]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 13988 000016EF 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 13989 000016F0 07                      		pop	es
 13990 000016F1 E9C4EE                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 13991                                  
 13992                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13993                                  
 13994                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13995                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 13996                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 13997                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 13998                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13999                                  
 14000                                  install_bds:		
 14001 000016F4 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14002 000016F5 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14003                                  
 14004                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14005                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14006                                  loop_next_bds:				
 14007 000016F8 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14008                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14009 000016FA 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14010 000016FE 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14011                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14012 00001701 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14013 00001703 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14014 00001705 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14015                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14016 00001709 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14017 0000170C 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14018                                  					; we don't own it
 14019 00001711 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14020                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14021 00001714 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14022 00001717 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14023                                  next_bds:				
 14024 0000171B 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14025                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14026 0000171E 75D8                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14027 00001720 8C4402                  		mov	word [si+2], es ; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14028                                  					; install bds
 14029 00001723 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14030 00001725 26C705FFFF              		mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14031                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14032 0000172A 1F                      		pop	ds
 14033                                  
 14034                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14035                                  ;
 14036                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14037                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14038                                  ;
 14039                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 14040                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 14041                                  ;		mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14042                                  ;
 14043                                  ;		cmp	al,[eot]
 14044                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14045                                  ;		mov	[eot],al
 14046                                  
 14047 0000172B C3                      		retn
 14048

 14054                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14055                                  DRVLET equ drvlet
 14056                                  SNGMSG equ sngmsg

 14061                                  ;  ask to swap the disk in drive a:
 14062                                  ;	es:di -> bds
 14063                                  ;	ds -> Bios_Data

 14066                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14067 0000172C F606[CE08]01            swpdsk:		test	byte [IsWin386], 1			
 14068                                  		;test	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Is win386 present?
 14069 00001731 7405                    		jz	short no_win386	; no, skip SetFocus
 14070                                  		
 14071                                  		; set focus to the correct VM
 14072                                  		;;call	far 70h:8D1h	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:179Ah
 14073                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14074 00001733 9A[CF08]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:V86_Crit_SetFocus
 14075                                  		;call	far ptr	V86_Crit_SetFocus ; call far 70h:8D1h
 14076                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus
 14077                                  no_win386:				
 14078 00001738 51                      		push	cx
 14079 00001739 52                      		push	dx
 14080 0000173A 268A5505                		mov	dl, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 14081                                  					; get the drive	letter
 14082                                  
 14083                                  ; WARNING : next two instructions assume that if the new disk is for drive B
 14084                                  ;           then existing dsk is drive A & vice versa
 14085                                  
 14086 0000173E 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl
 14087 00001740 80F601                  		xor	dh, 1
 14088 00001743 29C9                    		sub	cx, cx		; nobody has handled swap disk
 14089 00001745 B8004A                  		mov	ax, 4A00h	; multMULT<<8)|multMULTSWPDSK
 14090                                  					; broad	cast code for swap disk
 14091                                  					; Broadcast it
 14092 00001748 CD2F                    		int	2Fh	
 14093 0000174A 41                      		inc	cx		; cx == -1 ?
 14094 0000174B 741E                    		jz	short swpdsk9	; somebody has handled it
 14095                                  
 14096                                  ; using a different drive in a one drive system so request the user change disks
 14097                                  
 14098 0000174D 80C241                  		add	dl, 'A'
 14099                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14100 00001750 2E8816[8A17]            		mov	[cs:DRVLET], dl
 14101                                  		; 16/10/2022
 14102                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:drvlet], dl
 14103                                  		;mov	byte ptr cs:17E4h, dl ; [cs:drvlet]
 14104                                  					; 0070h:3D54h =	2C7h:17E4h
 14105 00001755 BE[6E17]                		mov	si, SNGMSG
 14106                                  		;mov	si, 17C8h	; sngmsg
 14107                                  					; 0070h:3D38h =	2C7h:17C8h
 14108 00001758 53                      		push	bx
 14109 00001759 2E                      		cs
 14110 0000175A AC                      		lodsb			; get the next character of the message
 14111                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si]
 14112                                  wrmsg_loop:				
 14113 0000175B CD29                    		int	29h		; DOS 2+ internal - FAST PUTCHAR
 14114                                  					; AL = character to display
 14115 0000175D 2E                      		cs
 14116 0000175E AC                      		lodsb
 14117                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
 14118                                  					; get the next character of the	message
 14119 0000175F 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14120 00001761 75F8                    		jnz	short wrmsg_loop
 14121 00001763 E8A1EA                  		call	con_flush	; flush out keyboard queue
 14122                                  					; call rom-bios
 14123 00001766 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14124 00001768 CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD - READ CHAR FROM BUFFER, WAIT IF EMPTY
 14125                                  					; Return: AH = scan code, AL = character
 14126 0000176A 5B                      		pop	bx
 14127                                  swpdsk9:				
 14128 0000176B 5A                      		pop	dx
 14129 0000176C 59                      		pop	cx
 14130 0000176D C3                      		retn
