 14972                                  
 14973                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 14974                                  ; SYSINIT.BIN (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) - RETRO DOS v4.0 by ERDOGAN TAN - 21/10/2022
 14975                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14976                                  ; Last Update: 04/01/2023 (Modified IO.SYS)  ((Previous: 30/12/2022))
 14977                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14978                                  ; Beginning: 03/06/2018 (Retro DOS 3.0), 21/03/2019 (Retro DOS 4.0)
 14979                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14980                                  ; Assembler: NASM version 2.15
 14981                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14982                                  ;	   ((nasm sysinit6.s -l sysinit6.lst -o SYSINIT6.BIN -Z error.txt)) 	
 14983                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14984                                  ; Modified from 'sysinit2.s' (SYSINIT2.BIN) file of Retro DOS v3.0 (6/7/2018)
 14985                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14986                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT1.ASM' and 'SYSINIT2.ASM' files of MSDOS 6.0
 14987                                  ; source code by Microsoft, 1991 
 14988                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14989                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT.ASM' file of MSDOS 2.0 (IBM PCDOS v2.0) source code
 14990                                  ; by Microsoft, 12/10/1983
 14991                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 14992                                  ; main file: 'retrodos4.s'
 14993                                  ; incbin 'SYSINIT3.BIN' ; (SYINITSEG)
 14994                                  
 14995                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 14996                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 - 2019
 14997                                  ; SYSINIT (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) draft: 'sysinit3.s' (01/07/2019)
 14998                                   
 14999                                  ; 21/10/2022
 15000                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15001                                  ; This source code (version) is based on SYSINIT source code of disassembled
 15002                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS file (SYSINIT.BIN) 
 15003                                  ; Dissassembler: Hex-Rays Interactive Disassembler (IDA)
 15004                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15005                                  ; Binary file splitter & joiner: FFSJ v3.3
 15006                                  
 15007                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15008                                  ; SYSINIT.TXT (27/01/1983)
 15009                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 15010                                  ;    SYSINIT is  a module linked behind the OEM bios.  It takes
 15011                                  ;over  the  system  initialization  after  the  OEM  bios   has
 15012                                  ;performed any  initialization  it  needs  to  do.   Control is
 15013                                  ;transfered with a long jump to the external  variable  SYSINIT
 15014                                  ;
 15015                                  ;
 15016                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared external:
 15017                                  ;
 15018                                  ;   CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION    WORD
 15019                                  ;
 15020                                  ;This word  contains  the  segment  number of the DOS before it
 15021                                  ;is relocated.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15022                                  ;
 15023                                  ;   FINAL_DOS_LOCATION      WORD
 15024                                  ;
 15025                                  ;This word contains the segment number of the DOS after SYSINIT
 15026                                  ;moves it.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 15027                                  ;
 15028                                  ;   DEVICE_LIST             DWORD
 15029                                  ;
 15030                                  ;This  double  word  pointer  points  to  the  linked  list  of
 15031                                  ;character and block device drivers.  The  OEM  must  set  this
 15032                                  ;value.
 15033                                  ;
 15034                                  ;   MEMORY_SIZE             WORD
 15035                                  ;
 15036                                  ;This word  contains  the  number  of  RAM  paragraphs.  If the
 15037                                  ;bios doesn't set  this  variable  SYSINIT  will  automatically
 15038                                  ;calculate it.   NOTE:  systems with PARITY checked memory must
 15039                                  ;size memory in the BIOS.  SYSINITs method is to  write  memory
 15040                                  ;and read it back until it gets a mismatch.
 15041                                  ;
 15042                                  ;   DEFAULT_DRIVE           BYTE
 15043                                  ;
 15044                                  ;This is  the initial default drive when the system first comes
 15045                                  ;up.  drive a=0, drive b=1,  etc.   If  the  bios  doesn't  set
 15046                                  ;it then drive a is assumed.
 15047                                  ;
 15048                                  ;   BUFFERS                 BYTE
 15049                                  ;
 15050                                  ;This is  the  default  number of buffers for the system.  This
 15051                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15052                                  ;It is DBed to 2 in SYSINIT it should be greater than 1.
 15053                                  ;
 15054                                  ;   FILES                   BYTE
 15055                                  ;
 15056                                  ;This is  the  default  number  of  files for the system.  This
 15057                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 15058                                  ;It is  DBed  to  8 in SYSINIT, values less than 5 are ignored.
 15059                                  ;
 15060                                  ;   SYSINIT                 FAR
 15061                                  ;
 15062                                  ;The entry  point  of  the  SYSINIT  module.  OEM BIOS jumps to
 15063                                  ;this label at the end of its INIT code.
 15064                                  ;
 15065                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared public:
 15066                                  ;
 15067                                  ;   RE_INIT                 FAR
 15068                                  ;
 15069                                  ;This is an entry point which allows the BIOS to do some INIT
 15070                                  ;work  after  the  DOS is initialized.  ALL REGISTERS MUST BE
 15071                                  ;PRESERVED.  On entry DS points to the first available memory
 15072                                  ;(after  the DOS).  DS:0 points to a 100H byte program header
 15073                                  ;prefix which represents  the  "program"  currently  running.
 15074                                  ;This  program  should  be  thought  of  as  the OEM BIOS and
 15075                                  ;SYSINIT taken together.  This is not  a  normal  program  in
 15076                                  ;that  no  memory  is  allocated to it, it is running in free
 15077                                  ;memory.
 15078                                  ;NOTES:
 15079                                  ;     At the time this routine is called SYSINIT occupies the
 15080                                  ;highest 10K of memory ("highest" is determined by the  value
 15081                                  ;of the MEMORY_SIZE variable), DO NOT DO WRITES THERE.
 15082                                  ;     Since this is called AFTER DOS is initialized, you can
 15083                                  ;make system calls.  This also implies that the code for this
 15084                                  ;routine    CANNOT   be   thrown   away   by   use   of   the
 15085                                  ;FINAL_DOS_LOCATION since the DOS has already been moved.
 15086                                  ;     If you don't want  anything done just set this to point
 15087                                  ;at a FAR RET instruction.
 15088                                  
 15089                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15090                                  ; TITLE   BIOS SYSTEM INITIALIZATION
 15091                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15092                                  
 15093                                  ;include version.inc
 15094                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15095                                  
 15096                                  ;FALSE   EQU     0
 15097                                  ;TRUE    EQU     0FFFFh
 15098                                  
 15099                                  ;IBMVER	    EQU     TRUE
 15100                                  ;IBMCOPYRIGHT EQU   FALSE
 15101                                  ;STACKSW    EQU	    TRUE		;Include Switchable Hardware Stacks
 15102                                  ;IBMJAPVER  EQU     FALSE		; If TRUE set KANJI true also
 15103                                  ;MSVER      EQU     FALSE
 15104                                  ;ALTVECT    EQU     FALSE		; Switch to build ALTVECT version
 15105                                  ;KANJI      EQU     FALSE
 15106                                  
 15107                                  ;(MSDOS 6.0, versiona.inc, 1991)
 15108                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15109                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION  EQU	6
 15110                                  ;;MINOR_VERSION	EQU	0	;6.00
 15111                                  ;MINOR_VERSION  EQU	21	;6.21  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15112                                  
 15113                                  ; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
 15114                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15115                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	5
 15116                                  ;MINOR_VERSION   EQU	0
 15117                                  
 15118                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21)
 15119                                  MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	6
 15120                                  MINOR_VERSION   EQU	22
 15121                                  
 15122                                  expected_version equ	(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION
 15123                                  
 15124                                  ;DOSREVNM equ	00000000b       ; m037 - bits 0-2 = revision number of DOS
 15125                                  				; currently 0.
 15126                                  DOSREVNM equ	00000111b	; [[[ 7 for Retro DOS v4.0 ]]] (21/03/2019)	
 15127                                  DOSINROM equ	00001000B       ; bit 3 of ver flags returned in BH
 15128                                  DOSINHMA equ	00010000B       ; bit 4 of ver flags 
 15129                                  
 15130                                  ;      if1
 15131                                  ;      %OUT  ... for DOS Version 5.00 ...
 15132                                  ;      endif
 15133                                  
 15134                                         ;******************************
 15135                                         ;Each assembler program should:
 15136                                         ;  mov ah,030h                   ;DOS Get Version function
 15137                                         ;  int 021h                      ;Version ret. in AX,minor version first
 15138                                         ;  cmp ax,expected_version       ;ALL utilities should check for an
 15139                                         ;  jne error_handler             ; EXACT version match.
 15140                                         ;******************************
 15141                                  
 15142                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15143                                  ; device definitions
 15144                                  
 15145                                  ;Attribute bit masks
 15146                                  DEVTYP  EQU     8000h           ;Bit 15 - 1  if Char, 0 if block
 15147                                  DEVIOCTL EQU    4000h           ;Bit 14 - CONTROL mode bit
 15148                                  ISFATBYDEV EQU  2000h           ;Bit 13 - Device uses FAT ID bytes, comp media.
 15149                                  ISCIN   EQU     0001h           ;Bit 0 - This device is the console input.
 15150                                  ISCOUT  EQU     0002h           ;Bit 1 - This device is the console output.
 15151                                  ISNULL  EQU     0004h           ;Bit 2 - This device is the null device.
 15152                                  ISCLOCK EQU     0008h           ;Bit 3 - This device is the clock device.
 15153                                  ISIBM   EQU     0010h           ;Bit 4 - This device is special
 15154                                  
 15155                                  ; The device table list has the form:
 15156                                  struc	SYSDEV
 15157 00000000 ????????                .NEXT:		resd 1		;Pointer to next device header
 15158 00000004 ????                    .ATT:		resw 1		;Attributes of the device
 15159 00000006 ????                    .STRAT:		resw 1		;Strategy entry point
 15160 00000008 ????                    .INT:		resw 1		;Interrupt entry point
 15161 0000000A ????????????????        .NAME:		resb 8		;Name of device (only first byte used for block)
 15162                                  .size:
 15163                                  endstruc
 15164                                  
 15165                                  ;Static Reguest Header
 15166                                  struc	SRHEAD
 15167 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
 15168 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 15169 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 15170 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 15171 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 15172                                  .size:
 15173                                  endstruc
 15174                                  
 15175                                  ;Status word masks
 15176                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 15177                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 15178                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 15179                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 15180                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 15181                                  
 15182                                  ;Function codes
 15183                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 15184                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 15185                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 15186                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 15187                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
 15188                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
 15189                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
 15190                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
 15191                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
 15192                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 15193                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 15194                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
 15195                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
 15196                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
 15197                                  DFLSHL  EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
 15198                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
 15199                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
 15200                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
 15201                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
 15202                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write
 15203                                  
 15204                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15205                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 15206 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 15207 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 15208 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 15209 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 15210 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 15211 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 15212                                                          ; word
 15213 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 15214 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 15215 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 15216 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 15217                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 15218                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 15219                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15220                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15221                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15222                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15223                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 15224                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15225 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 15226 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 15227 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 15228 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 15229 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 15230 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 15231                                  .size:
 15232                                  endstruc
 15233                                  
 15234                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15235                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 15236                                  
 15237                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 15238                                  
 15239                                  struc buffinfo
 15240 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 15241 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 15242 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15243                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 15244                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 15245 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 15246                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 15247                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 15248                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 15249                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 15250                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 15251                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 15252                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 15253                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 15254 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15255                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 15256 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 15257 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 15258 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 15259 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 15260 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 15261                                  .size:
 15262                                  endstruc
 15263                                  
 15264                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 15265                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 15266                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 15267                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 15268                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 15269                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 15270                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 15271                                  
 15272                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 15273                                  
 15274                                  
 15275                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 15276                                  
 15277                                  ;Flag byte masks
 15278                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 15279                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 15280                                  ;***
 15281                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 15282                                  ;***
 15283                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 15284                                  
 15285                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 15286                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 15287                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 15288                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 15289                                  
 15290                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz

 15294                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15295                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 15296                                  
 15297                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 15298                                  
 15299                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 15300                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 15301                                  ;
 15302                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 15303                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 15304                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 15305                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 15306                                  ;
 15307                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 15308                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 15309                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 15310                                  
 15311                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 15312                                  
 15313                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15314                                  
 15315                                  struc	DPB
 15316 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 15317 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 15318 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 15319 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 15320 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 15321 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 15322 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 15323 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 15324 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 15325 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 15326                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15327 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 15328 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 15329 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 15330 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 15331 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 15332                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 15333 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 15334 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 15335 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 15336                                  .size:
 15337                                  endstruc
 15338                                  
 15339                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 15340                                  
 15341                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)
 15342

 15398                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 15399                                  
 15400                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 15401                                  ;
 15402                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 15403                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 15404                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 15405                                  ;
 15406                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 15407                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 15408                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 15409                                  ;
 15410                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 15411                                  
 15412                                  struc A_BPB
 15413 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 15414 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 15415 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 15416 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 15417 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 15418 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15419 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 15420 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 15421 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 15422 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 15423 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 15424 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 15425 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15426 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 15427 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 15428                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 15429                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 15430                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 15431                                  .size:
 15432                                  endstruc
 15433                                  
 15434                                  struc A_DEVICEPARAMETERS
 15435 00000000 ??                      .DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS:	resb	1
 15436 00000001 ??                      .DP_DEVICETYPE:		resb	1
 15437 00000002 ????                    .DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES:	resw	1
 15438 00000004 ????                    .DP_CYLINDERS:		resw	1
 15439 00000006 ??                      .DP_MEDIATYPE:		resb	1
 15440 00000007 <res 1Fh>               .DP_BPB:		resb	A_BPB.size
 15441 00000026 ????                    .DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES:	resw	1
 15442 00000028 <res FCh>               .DP_SECTORTABLE:	resb	MAX_SECTORS_IN_TRACK * A_SECTORTABLE.size
 15443                                  endstruc

 15691                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15692                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 15693                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15694                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 15695                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 15696                                  									  
 15697                                  ;*******************************					  
 15698                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 15699                                  ;*******************************					  
 15700                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 15701                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 15702                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 15703                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15704                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 15705                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 15706                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15707                                  ;For all others:							  
 15708                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 15709                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 15710                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 15711                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 15712                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 15713                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 15714                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 15715                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 15716                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15717                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 15718                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 15719                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 15720                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 15721                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 15722                                  ;									  
 15723                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 15724                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 15725                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15726                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 15727                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 15728                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 15729                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 15730                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 15731                                  ;									  
 15732                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 15733                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 15734                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 15735                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 15736                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 15737                                  ;									  
 15738                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 15739                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 15740                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 15741                                  ;									  
 15742                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 15743                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 15744                                  ;									  
 15745                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 15746                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 15747                                  ;									  
 15748                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 15749                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 15750                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 15751                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 15752                                  ;						called. 		  
 15753                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 15754                                  ;									  
 15755                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15756                                  ;									  
 15757                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15758                                  ;									  
 15759                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15760                                  ;									  
 15761                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15762                                  ;									  
 15763                                  
 15764                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 15765                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 15766 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 15767 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 15768                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 15769 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 15770 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 15771 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 15772 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 15773                                  endstruc

 15778                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b

 15882                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15883                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 15884                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15885                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15886                                  
 15887                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 15888                                  ;
 15889                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 15890                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 15891                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 15892                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 15893                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 15894                                  ;
 15895                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 15896                                  ;
 15897                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 15898                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 15899                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 15900                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 15901                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 15902                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 15903                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 15904                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 15905                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 15906                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 15907                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 15908                                  
 15909                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 15910                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 15911                                  
 15912                                  struc 		curdir_list
 15913                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15914 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 15915 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 15916 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 15917 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 15918 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 15919 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 15920                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 15921 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 15922 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 15923 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 15924                                  .size:
 15925                                  endstruc
 15926                                  
 15927                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 15928                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 15929                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 15930                                  						; argument
 15931                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 15932

 15934

 15937                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B

 15940                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 15942                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15943                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 15944                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15945                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15946                                  
 15947                                  ; system file table
 15948                                  
 15949                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 15950                                  ;
 15951                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 15952                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 15953                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 15954                                  
 15955                                  struc	SF
 15956 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 15957 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 15958 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 15959                                  .size:
 15960                                  endstruc
 15961                                  
 15962                                  ;**	System file table entry
 15963                                  ;
 15964                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 15965                                  
 15966                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 15967 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 15968                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 15969 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 15970 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 15971 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 15972                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 15973                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 15974                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 15975                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 15976                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 15977                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 15978                                  					;   (WRITE)
 15979                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 15980                                  					;
 15981                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 15982                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 15983                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 15984                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 15985                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 15986                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 15987                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15988                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15989                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15990                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15991                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 15992                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15993 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 15994                                  					; to device header if local device,
 15995                                  					; points to net device header if
 15996                                  					; remote
 15997 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 15998                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 15999 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 16000 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 16001 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 16002 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 16003                                  ;
 16004                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 16005                                  ; ID
 16006                                  ;
 16007 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 16008 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file

 16297                                  	;IF	STACKSW

 16304                                  ; 05/07/2018
 16305                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16306                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16307                                  
 16308                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16309                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 16310                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16311                                  
 16312                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 16313                                  ;
 16314                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 16315                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 16316                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 16317                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 16318                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 16319                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 16320                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 16321                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 16322                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 16323                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 16324                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 16325                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 16326                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 16327                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 16328                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 16329                                  ;
 16330                                  
 16331                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 16332                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 16333                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 16334                                  ;
 16335                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 16336                                  ;
 16337                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 16338                                  ;
 16339                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 16340                                  ;
 16341                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 16342                                  ;
 16343                                  
 16344                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 16345                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 16346                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 16347                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 16348                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 16349                                  ;      deeply nested one
 16350                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 16351                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 16352                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 16353                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 16354                                  
 16355                                  		;EVEN
 16356                                  ;align 2
 16357                                  		; 21/10/2022
 16358                                  
 16359 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 16360 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 16361 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 16362 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 16363 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 16364 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 16365                                  
 16366 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 16367 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16368 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16369                                  
 16370                                  ;***********************************************************************
 16371                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 16372                                  
 16373                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16374                                  
 16375 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 16376                                  
 16377                                  int02:
 16378                                  
 16379                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16380                                  ;
 16381                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 16382                                  ;
 16383                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 16384                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 16385                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 16386                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 16387                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 16388                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 16389                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 16390                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 16391                                  ;
 16392                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 16393                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 16394                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 16395                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 16396                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 16397                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 16398                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 16399                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 16400                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 16401                                  ;
 16402                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16403                                  
 16404 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 16405 00000017 06                      	push	es
 16406 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 16407 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 16408                                  	; 02/11/2022
 16409 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 16410 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 16411 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 16412                                  
 16413 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 16414                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 16415                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 16416                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 16417                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 16418 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 16419 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 16420                                  special02:
 16421 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 16422 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 16423                                  normal02:
 16424 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 16425 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 16426 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02
 16427                                  
 16428                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16429

 16652                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16653                                  
 16654                                  ;********************************************************************
 16655                                  ;common routines
 16656                                  ;********************************************************************
 16657                                  
 16658                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 16659                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 16660                                  ; service routine
 16661                                  
 16662                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 16663                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16664                                  
 16665                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 16666                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 16667                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 16668                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 16669                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 16670                                  
 16671                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 16672                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO:SYS, SYSINIT:0147h)
 16673                                  
 16674                                  do_int_stacks:
 16675 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 16676 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 16677 00000149 06                      	push	es
 16678 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 16679 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 16680 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 16681                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16682                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 16683                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16684 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 16685 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 16686 0000015C 754F                    	jne	short notfree02
 16687                                  
 16688 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 16689                                  
 16690                                  found02:
 16691 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 16692 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 16693                                  
 16694 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 16695                                  
 16696 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 16697                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16698                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 16699                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16700                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 16701 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 16702 00000176 7542                    	jne	short foundbad02
 16703                                  
 16704                                  	;mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 16705                                  	;mov	es,bp
 16706                                  	;mov	bp,sp
 16707                                  	;mov	bp,[bp+6]
 16708                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 16709                                  	;mov	sp,es
 16710                                  	;mov	es,ax
 16711                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 16712                                  
 16713                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 code SYSINIT code)
 16714 00000178 55                      	push    bp
 16715 00000179 89E5                    	mov     bp,sp
 16716 0000017B 8B4608                  	mov     ax,[bp+8]
 16717 0000017E 5D                      	pop     bp
 16718 0000017F 06                      	push    es
 16719 00000180 17                      	pop     ss
 16720 00000181 89EC                    	mov     sp,bp
 16721 00000183 89C5                    	mov     bp,ax
 16722                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16723                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 16724 00000185 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 16725                                  
 16726 00000189 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 16727                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16728 0000018A 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 16729                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16730                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 16731                                  
 16732 0000018E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 16733                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16734 00000190 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 16735                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16736                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 16737 00000194 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 16738 00000198 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 16739                                  
 16740                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16741                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 16742                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16743 0000019C 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 16744 000001A1 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 16745                                  
 16746 000001A6 07                      	pop	es
 16747 000001A7 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 16748 000001A8 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 16749 000001A9 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 16750 000001AC CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 16751                                  
 16752                                  notfree02:
 16753 000001AD 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 16754 000001AF 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 16755                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16756                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 16757                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16758 000001B1 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16759                                  
 16760                                  findnext02:
 16761 000001B5 E81200                  	call	longpath
 16762 000001B8 EBAA                    	jmp	short found02
 16763                                  
 16764                                  foundbad02:
 16765 000001BA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16766 000001BF 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 16767 000001C1 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 16768                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16769                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 16770                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16771 000001C3 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 16772 000001C8 EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 16773                                  
 16774                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16775                                  
 16776                                  ; Common routines
 16777                                  
 16778                                  longpath:
 16779                                  	; 21/03/2019
 16780 000001CA 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 16781                                  lploopp:
 16782                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16783                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 16784                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16785 000001CF 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 16786 000001D4 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 16787                                  
 16788 000001D6 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 16789                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16790                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 16791                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16792 000001D8 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16793 000001DC 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 16794 000001DE 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 16795                                  
 16796 000001E0 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 16797 000001E2 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 16798                                  
 16799                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16800                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 16801                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16802 000001E4 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 16803                                  inuse:
 16804 000001E8 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16805 000001ED 7406                    	je	short fatal
 16806 000001EF 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 16807 000001F2 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 16808                                  found:
 16809 000001F4 C3                      	retn
 16810                                  fatal:
 16811 000001F5 1E                      	push	ds
 16812 000001F6 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 16813 000001F9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 16814 000001FB 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 16815 00000200 1F                      	pop	ds
 16816 00000201 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 16817                                  
 16818 00000203 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 16819 00000205 E672                    	out	72h,al
 16820                                  
 16821                                  skip_nmis:
 16822 00000207 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 16823 00000208 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 16824 0000020A E621                    	out	021h,al
 16825 0000020C E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 16826                                  
 16827 0000020E 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 16828 00000210 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 16829 00000212 BE[3902]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 16830                                  ;SR;
 16831                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 16832                                  ;
 16833 00000215 50                      	push	ax
 16834 00000216 1E                      	push	ds
 16835                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 16836                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 16837                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16838 00000217 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 16839 0000021A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 16840                                  
 16841                                  	;test	byte [08D0h],1 	; (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:021Eh)
 16842 0000021C F606[CE08]01            	test	byte [IsWin386],1 ; (retrodos4.sys, offset: ****h)
 16843 00000221 1F                      	pop	ds
 16844 00000222 58                      	pop	ax
 16845 00000223 7405                    	jz	short fatal_loop	; win386 not present, continue
 16846                                  
 16847                                  	;;call	far ptr 0070h:08D1h ; (MSDOS 621, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0227h)
 16848                                  	;call	KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; set focus to this VM
 16849                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16850 00000225 9A[CF08]7000            	call	DOSBIODATASEG:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; 0070h:08D1h
 16851                                  ;
 16852                                  ;SR; We do not bother about the returned status of this call. 
 16853                                  ;
 16854                                  fatal_loop:
 16855 0000022A AC                      	lodsb
 16856 0000022B 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'
 16857 0000022D 7408                    	je	short fatal_done
 16858                                  
 16859 0000022F B307                    	mov	bl,7
 16860 00000231 B40E                    	mov	ah,14
 16861 00000233 CD10                    	int	10h			; whoops, this enables ints
 16862 00000235 EBF3                    	jmp	short fatal_loop
 16863                                  
 16864                                  fatal_done:
 16865 00000237 EBFE                    	jmp	short fatal_done

 18068                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 18069                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 18070                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 18071                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 18072                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 18073                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 18074                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 18075                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 18076                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 18077                                  ;
 18078                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 18079                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 18080                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 18081                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 18082                                  ; been patched.

 18396                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18397                                  
 18398                                  ;   Once we get to this point, the above code, which is below "retry"
 18399                                  ;   in memory, can be trashed (and in fact is -- see references to retry
 18400                                  ;   which follow....)
 18401                                  
 18402                                  retry:
 18403 00000780 BA[0347]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 18404                                  
 18405                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 18406                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 18407                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 18408                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 18409                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 18410                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 18411                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 18412                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 18413                                  
 18414                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 18415                                  
 18416 00000783 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 18417 00000784 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh

 18419 00000789 CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece
 18420 0000078B B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 18421 0000078D CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 18422 0000078F 726B                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 18423                                  
 18424 00000791 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18425 00000793 B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 18426 00000795 CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 18427 00000797 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 18428                                  
 18429                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 18430                                  
 18431                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 18432                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 18433                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 18434                                  
 18435                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18436                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)

 18438 0000079D 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 18439                                  
 18440                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 18441                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 18442                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 18443                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 18444                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 18445                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 18446                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 18447                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 18448                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 18449                                  ;
 18450                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 18451                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 18452                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 18453                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 18454                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 18455                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 18456                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 18457                                  
 18458                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)

 18839
